original: 'di ltar nges zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bas nye bar bsdus par byas pa'i stobs gzhan gsungs pa ni mi 'byung zhes bya ba ste mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nges zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bas nye bar bsdus par byas pa'i stobs gzhan gsungs pa ni mi 'byung zhes bya ba ste mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, he declares another power, which is the cause of the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings, with the words: ‚Äúit does not occur. ‚Äù It does not occur means it does not arise.

original: shes par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ming la sogs pa rnams kyang mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ming la sogs pa rnams kyang mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not known means that even the names, etc., are not heard.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba nyid ni dge ba ste de la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba nyid ni dge ba ste de la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The root of the relinquishment of all possessions is the relinquishment of all possessions, which is virtue.

original: lus kyang rab tu bor zhing zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir dang chos yongs su tshol ba'i rgyu mtshan du lus kyang yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyang rab tu bor zhing zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir dang chos yongs su tshol ba'i rgyu mtshan du lus kyang yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He also relinquishes his body for the sake of sentient beings and for the sake of the Dharma, because he seeks the Dharma.

original: yo byad ni ci nas kyang bskyed par bya ba'i chos gos la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yo byad ni ci nas kyang bskyed par bya ba'i chos gos la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The requisites are the Dharma robes, etc., which are to be produced.

original: gzhan ni nye bar mkho ba rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan ni nye bar mkho ba rnams so //
translated: The other requisites are the necessities.

original: sbyin pa de ni byin par gyur cig ces bya ba ni sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir bdag gi don 'ga' zhig nye bar mkho ba 'dis mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa de ni byin par gyur cig ces bya ba ni sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir bdag gi don 'ga' zhig nye bar mkho ba 'dis mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: May that generosity be given! means May this which is needed for my own purpose be desired by them for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: de bas na gal te de rnams la 'di nyid kyis don du gnyer ba nyid de bas na 'di nyid sbyin pa byin par gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na gal te de rnams la 'di nyid kyis don du gnyer ba nyid de bas na 'di nyid sbyin pa byin par gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, if they are in need of this very thing, then may this very thing be given as a gift.

original: gnod sems ni sems can rnams la sdang ba'o //
analyzed: gnod sems ni sems can rnams la sdang ba'o //
translated: Malice is hostility towards sentient beings.

original: khro ba ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul can rnams la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul can rnams la gnod pa'o //
translated: Anger is the harmfulness towards sentient beings and non-sentient objects.

original: zhe sdang ni sems la 'jog pa dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni sems la 'jog pa dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: Hatred is the connection with the placement of the mind.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi lus la sogs pa gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi lus la sogs pa gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of generosity is due to giving up one's own body and so forth.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzhan la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnod pa byed pa rnams @238a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzhan la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnod pa byed pa rnams @238a * //
translated: The perfection of morality is due to not harming others.

original: la mi khro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la mi khro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of patience is due to not getting angry with those who do harm.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems can gyi don nyid la dge ba'i chos yid la byed pa'i phyir dang rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba la phan pa'i smon lam du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sems can gyi don nyid la dge ba'i chos yid la byed pa'i phyir dang rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba la phan pa'i smon lam du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of effort is for the sake of sentient beings themselves, because one attends to virtuous qualities and makes prayers of aspiration for the benefit of all beings in every way.

original: gnas 'di la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas 'di la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ma yin no //
translated: The perfection of effort is not recited in this context.

original: nye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mthus tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchus dgon par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mthus tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro // chus dgon par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Appropriated means that the accumulations are completed through the power of generosity and so on that is consistent with the attainment of enlightenment.üîΩA desert of water is

original: chus spangs pa'i dgon pa ni chu'i dgon pa'o //
analyzed: chus spangs pa'i dgon pa ni chu'i dgon pa'o //
translated: a desert devoid of water.

original: kun du mi skrag pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni brtan pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'gro ba thams cad skyob pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du mi skrag pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni brtan pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'gro ba thams cad skyob pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not frightened means that those who are endowed with the application of the distinctive stability have power over the protection of all beings.

original: srid pa thams cad bcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad bcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to cut off all existence means in order to abandon the attachment of the three realms.

original: de la chu'i dgon pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la chu'i dgon pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Here, one should say: What is this so-called 'desert of water'?

original: skom pas 'chi ba'i dus byed par gyur na zhes bya ba ni srog 'gag pa'i dus na yang bdag gis rang gi sdug bsngal dang bde ba yid la mi bya ba ste 'on kyang de dang de'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i smon lam
analyzed: skom pas 'chi ba'i dus byed par gyur na zhes bya ba ni srog 'gag pa'i dus na yang bdag gis rang gi sdug bsngal dang bde ba yid la mi bya ba ste 'on kyang de dang de'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'i smon lam
translated: This is the intention. Even when dying of thirst means that even when the life-force is ceasing, one should not attend to one's own suffering and happiness, but rather make the aspiration for the complete pacification of the suffering of those sentient beings.

original: bya'o zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention.

original: yi dgas kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yi dgas kyi 'jig rten tu skye ba'i yang dag par grub par bya ba'i las gang la yod pa de la de'i las la sred pas 'chi ba'i dus su lhan cig byed pa blangs nas
analyzed: yi dgas kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yi dgas kyi 'jig rten tu skye ba'i yang dag par grub par bya ba'i las gang la yod pa de la de'i las la sred pas 'chi ba'i dus su lhan cig byed pa blangs nas
translated: One will be born in the world of hungry ghosts means that in the action which is the true establishment of being born in the world of hungry ghosts, having taken up the co-existent craving for that action at the time of death, one will be born in the world of hungry ghosts.

original: 'bras bu ster ba la mngon par phyogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba rjod par byed pa ni yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ster ba la mngon par phyogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba rjod par byed pa ni yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression will be inclined to grant the fruit refers to water endowed with eight factors.

original: bsil dang yang dang 'jam dang zhim //üîΩdri mi zhim spangs dang ba dang // 'thungs dang 'thung bar 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: bsil dang yang dang 'jam dang zhim // dri mi zhim spangs dang ba dang // 'thungs dang 'thung bar 'gyur ba ni //
translated: Cool, light, soft, sweet,üîΩpure, not foul smelling,

original: lto ba mgrin pa la mi gnod //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lto ba mgrin pa la mi gnod // ces bya ba'o //
translated: and not harmful to the throat or gullet when drunk.

original: skyid pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skyid pa dang zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The word happiness is the brief presentation.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa ni bde ba dang sbyor ba can no //
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa ni bde ba dang sbyor ba can no //
translated: The word endowed with happiness means associated with happiness.

original: bde ba thams cad dang phrad par 'gyur ba 'di rnams la yod pas na bde ba thams cad dang phrad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad dang phrad par 'gyur ba 'di rnams la yod pas na bde ba thams cad dang phrad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: Since these have the attainment of all happiness, it is called the attainment of all happiness. This is the extensive explanation.

original: 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dus gcig pa rnam pa thams cad du 'grub pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dus gcig pa rnam pa thams cad du 'grub pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word will be accomplished means that they will be produced in every way at one time.

original: 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rim gyis rdzogs pa nyid rnyed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rim gyis rdzogs pa nyid rnyed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase will come about means that one will attain perfection gradually.

original: @238b thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad du'o //
analyzed: @238b thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad du'o //
translated: The phrase in every way means in all ways.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa lnga la sogs pa spangs pas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa lnga la sogs pa spangs pas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the perfection of meditative absorption means that one attains the first meditative absorption, etc., by abandoning the five faults, etc.

original: nad kyi dgon par zhes bya ba ni nad kyis nye bar 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: nad kyi dgon par zhes bya ba ni nad kyis nye bar 'tshe ba'o //
translated: The phrase in the wilderness of illness means that one is afflicted by illness.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pas grangs med pa gsum du ci nas kyang 'khor ba'i phyir dus ring po mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rnam par rtog pa yang mi bya zhes gsungs pa ni dang bar mi bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pas grangs med pa gsum du ci nas kyang 'khor ba'i phyir dus ring po mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rnam par rtog pa yang mi bya zhes gsungs pa ni dang bar mi bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase one should not even entertain the thought of fully realizing unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment for a long time means that one should not have any desire for it, etc.

original: dus ring por mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rnam par rtog pa yang dag par 'os pa nyid ci ltar mi bya zhes de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni sems kyi skad cig gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dus ring por mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rnam par rtog pa yang dag par 'os pa nyid ci ltar mi bya zhes de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni sems kyi skad cig gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Why is that? He says: ‚ÄúWhatever is a moment of thought, etc.‚Äù

original: don ni 'di yin te kun rdzob tu yang sems kyi skad cig rgyun las tha dad pa dus zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te sems kyi skad cig ma rnams kyang re rer skyes pa tsam nyid rnam par 'jig pas g-yo bar byed pa de
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te kun rdzob tu yang sems kyi skad cig rgyun las tha dad pa dus zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te sems kyi skad cig ma rnams kyang re rer skyes pa tsam nyid rnam par 'jig pas g-yo bar byed pa de
translated: The meaning is as follows: Even conventionally, there is no so-called time that is separate from the continuum of moments of thought. And the moments of thought are destroyed as soon as they arise, and so they move.

original: bas na su zhig la ring ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bas na su zhig la ring ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, how can there be a so-called long duration?

original: 'di tsam pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi skad cig ma'i tshad do //
analyzed: 'di tsam pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi skad cig ma'i tshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis much‚Äù refers to the measure of a moment of thought.

original: sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la bdag gis 'khor bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la bdag gis 'khor bar bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNever before‚Äù refers to the beginning of cyclic existence.

original: mtha' med pa'o zhes bya ba ni cha dang bral ba'i skad cig ma la mtha' yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtha' med pa'o zhes bya ba ni cha dang bral ba'i skad cig ma la mtha' yod pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout end‚Äù means that the moment without parts has no end.

original: de ltar rim pa 'dis dus ring po bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyis dka' ba'i 'dus shes bskyed par mi bya ba rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis dus ring po bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyis dka' ba'i 'dus shes bskyed par mi bya ba rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: Thus, one should not generate the notion that it is difficult to practice because it is to be practiced for a long time.

original: gsungs pa ni mang zhing yun ring ba'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni mang zhing yun ring ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚Äúmany and long.‚Äù

original: sngon med pa'i tha ma 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngon med pa'i tha ma 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the end of the unprecedented.

original: sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The unprecedented is the future.

original: ci'i phyir ring ba zhes bya ba ni 'du shes skye bar mi bya zhe na gsungs pa ni sems kyi skad cig ma gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ring ba zhes bya ba ni 'du shes skye bar mi bya zhe na gsungs pa ni sems kyi skad cig ma gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Why is it called long? One should not generate the notion that it is difficult to practice because it is to be practiced for a long time.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma re re tsam las tha dad pa cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma re re tsam las tha dad pa cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is not the slightest difference in each moment of mind.

original: gang zhig ring ba sngon med pa'i mtha' zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ring ba sngon med pa'i mtha' zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: What is called long is the end of the unprecedented.

original: de nyid gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste mtha' med pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste mtha' med pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That itself is said to be ‚Äúlike the endless.‚Äù

original: snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: As before, it should be explained.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: Thus is a summary.

original: 'jigs pa mi bzad pa zhes bya ba la gtan du ba'i 'jigs pa'i rgyu rnams 'jigs pa mi bzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa mi bzad pa zhes bya ba la gtan du ba'i 'jigs pa'i rgyu rnams 'jigs pa mi bzad pa'o //
translated: The cause of permanent fear is called ‚Äúintolerable fear.‚ÄùüîΩHow will I speak as the TathƒÅgatas spoke?

original: ci ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa smra bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad par mdzad cing smon lam rnams kyang @239a * //üîΩmdzad pa de ltar bdag kyang byed ces de'i phyir gsungs pa smra bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa smra bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad par mdzad cing smon lam rnams kyang @239a * // mdzad pa de ltar bdag kyang byed ces de'i phyir gsungs pa smra bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In this way, ‚ÄúI will do as the TathƒÅgatas in the past, when they were practicing the bodhisattva way of life, made their aspirations.‚ÄùüîΩFor this reason, ‚ÄúI will speak as they spoke.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du bya bas sgrub pa'i phyir ci ltar gsungs pa bzhin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bya bas sgrub pa'i phyir ci ltar gsungs pa bzhin du byed pa'o //
translated: Because of acting in that way, ‚ÄúI will do as they did.‚Äù

original: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi mtshan ma dang klog pa nye bar bsdus pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi mtshan ma dang klog pa nye bar bsdus pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the complete abandonment of the signs of bad wisdom and the complete abandonment of the signs of bad wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam 'di thams cad la 'byung ba yin te 'on kyang dgongs pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyis smon lam sna tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam 'di thams cad la 'byung ba yin te 'on kyang dgongs pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyis smon lam sna tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of these prayers are found among the bodhisattvas. However, they are of various kinds because of the various intentions.

original: 'ga' zhig ni rnam pa thams cad du yang smon lam byed pa phyis sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis cung zad 'grub pa dang cung zad mi 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni rnam pa thams cad du yang smon lam byed pa phyis sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis cung zad 'grub pa dang cung zad mi 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Some are prayers that are always fulfilled, while others are not fulfilled because of the power of the karma of sentient beings.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa de la gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa de la gang zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ba de nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: Then, the Bhagavat, having understood the thoughts of those bodhisattvas, etc.

original: 'dzum pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dzum pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He smiled.

original: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad las 'od zer nges par phyung ba ni 'dir 'dzum pa zhes smra'o //
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag thams cad las 'od zer nges par phyung ba ni 'dir 'dzum pa zhes smra'o //
translated: Here, a smile is said to be the definite emission of light rays from all the major and minor parts of the body.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gser gyi kha dog lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gser gyi kha dog lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: Therefore, it is distinguished as having the color of gold.

original: 'di lta ste dbab pas 'dzum pa'i sgra'i don gling bzhi las bshad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dbab pas 'dzum pa'i sgra'i don gling bzhi las bshad pa kho na'o //
translated: The meaning of the word smile is explained only in the four continents, as follows.

original: chags pa med par zhes bya ba ni sbyar ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa med par zhes bya ba ni sbyar ba med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout attachment‚Äù means without application.

original: bar snang gi nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' gcig pu nyid la'o //
analyzed: bar snang gi nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' gcig pu nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the sky‚Äù means in the one sky.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la lung bstan par bzhed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe spyi bor 'od zer rnams mi snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la lung bstan par bzhed par 'gyur ba de'i tshe spyi bor 'od zer rnams mi snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the Lord wishes to prophesy perfect enlightenment, then the light rays disappear from the crown.

original: mtshan mar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa kun dga' bo dri bar byed pa ni rgyu gang lags rkyen gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa kun dga' bo dri bar byed pa ni rgyu gang lags rkyen gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to grasp the sign, the noble Ananda asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the cause? What is the condition?‚Äù

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i snga rol du yang lung bstan par mdzad cing gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa'i snga rol du yang lung bstan par mdzad cing gsungs pa ni /
translated: The prophecy is made and the prediction is spoken even before the attainment of perfect enlightenment:

original: sring mo gang g'a'i lha mo 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sring mo gang g'a'i lha mo 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSister, this Ganga Devi‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lung bstan pa thob pa'i phyir mi ldog pa nyid la der skyes pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyan thos kyi lugs kyis rab tu grags pa nyid de theg pa chen po'i lugs kyis bstan par bya'o //

translated: Therein, the three aspects of impermanence are distinguished by way of the three natures: the imagined nature is never existent, therefore it is impermanent.

analyzed: skad cig ma re rer skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan dbang yang mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The other-dependent is impermanent because it has the nature of arising and passing away in each moment.

analyzed: sngar ni 'khor ba'i gnas skabs la dri ma dang bcas pa'i rnam par grol ba dri ma dang bral ba de'i phyir yongs su grub pa yang mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Previously, in the state of cyclic existence, it was the liberation that is associated with defilement, and now it is the liberation that is free from defilement. Therefore, the perfected also is impermanent.

original: de ltar na yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gsungs pa /

translated: correspond respectively to the fundamental reality.üîΩThe three natures are the fundamental reality. The imagined nature is suffering, because it generates the clinging to the personal entity and the dharmas.

original: kun brtags kyi ngo bo ni rang nyid kyis med pa'i phyir gal te yang rang gi ngo bos sdug bsngal bar byed pa ma yin pa de lta na yang gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pas gang zhig kun brtags kyi yongs su 'dzin pa de gnod
analyzed: kun brtags kyi ngo bo ni rang nyid kyis med pa'i phyir gal te yang rang gi ngo bos sdug bsngal bar byed pa ma yin pa de lta na yang gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pas gang zhig kun brtags kyi yongs su 'dzin pa de gnod
translated: Although the imagined nature is not suffering by itself, nevertheless, because of the clinging to the personal entity and the dharmas, that which is imagined by the imagined nature is suffering, because of the harm that is caused.

analyzed: par byed pa de bas na de'i sdug bsngal nyid brjod pa yin no //

translated: In that regard refers to the supernormal power of truth that was just mentioned.

original: brtson par byed pa zhes bya ba ni skabs thob pa la rang gi las byed pa'i don spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson par byed pa zhes bya ba ni skabs thob pa la rang gi las byed pa'i don spro ba'o //
translated: The phrase striving means the enthusiasm for one's own duty in the present context.

original: stobs ni spro ba'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: stobs ni spro ba'i nus pa'o //
translated: Power means the ability to be enthusiastic.

original: gzi brjid ni mthu'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid ni mthu'i nus pa'o //
translated: Splendor means the ability to be powerful.

original: gzi brjid kyis cher 'bar ba ni shin tu gzi brjid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba kha cig go //
analyzed: gzi brjid kyis cher 'bar ba ni shin tu gzi brjid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba kha cig go //
translated: Some say that shining with splendor means being endowed with great splendor.

original: sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i don du smon lam tsam byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen pos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i don du smon lam tsam byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase great being means that he is only a bodhisattva because he has merely made a vow for the sake of the world.

original: de brtson pa de tsam zhig byed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni nus pas stong pa'i tshig tsam las de ma thag tu bdud kyis byas pa'i mi ma yin gyi 'gro bas so //
analyzed: de brtson pa de tsam zhig byed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni nus pas stong pa'i tshig tsam las de ma thag tu bdud kyis byas pa'i mi ma yin gyi 'gro bas so //
translated: The phrase he would strive in that way means that he would strive in that way because of his ability. Immediately after the mere words of the empty vow, the beings created by Mara would say, You are not able to do that.

original: brtson pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la nga rgyal mang bas gzhan smod pa la @246b sogs pa spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la nga rgyal mang bas gzhan smod pa la @246b sogs pa spro ba'o //
translated: The phrase striving means enthusiasm for the disparagement of others, etc., because of the abundance of pride in oneself.

original: brnyas par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: brnyas par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase disparaging refers to the following.

original: brnyas pa ni gus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: brnyas pa ni gus pa med pa'o //
translated: Disparagement means lack of respect.

original: sngan chad ni khyod cag kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngan chad ni khyod cag kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: You were also called bodhisattvas in the past.

original: gal te de ltar yin na ci zhig mi ma yin gyis 'gro ba la sogs pa khyed cag kyang ci ste mi byed ces bya ba bzhad gad dang bcas pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na ci zhig mi ma yin gyis 'gro ba la sogs pa khyed cag kyang ci ste mi byed ces bya ba bzhad gad dang bcas pa'i tshig go //
translated: If that is so, why do you not also do what is not human, such as going through the air? This is a contemptuous statement.

original: sting bar byed pa ni yid kyis dor bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: sting bar byed pa ni yid kyis dor bar byas pa'o //
translated: Disparaging means to cast away with the mind.

original: 'phya bar byed pa ni skyon mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'phya bar byed pa ni skyon mthong ba nyid do //
translated: Scorn means to see faults.

original: smod par byed pa ni skyon smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: smod par byed pa ni skyon smra ba nyid do //
translated: Contempt means to speak of faults.

original: nga rgyal skyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal skyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Causing pride to arise, etc.

original: skyed pa ni skyed par byed pa'o //üîΩ'phel bar byed pa ni mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: skyed pa ni skyed par byed pa'o // 'phel bar byed pa ni mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: Causing to arise means to cause to arise.üîΩ Causing to increase means to manifest.

original: ston par byed pa ni bstan par byas pa'o //üîΩrgyas par byas pa ni yongs su rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: ston par byed pa ni bstan par byas pa'o // rgyas par byas pa ni yongs su rgyas pa'o //
translated: Causing to appear means to make appear.üîΩ Causing to expand means to fully expand.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa'i yongs su rgyas pa ni nye bar rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa'i yongs su rgyas pa ni nye bar rgyas pa'o //
translated: Causing to be special means to fully expand.

original: 'byung bar byed pa ni ring du khyer ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar byed pa ni ring du khyer ba'o //
translated: Causing to occur means to carry far.

original: nga rgyal nges zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzhan rnams las lhag pa nyid kyis sems kyi mtho ba ni phyir nga rgyal te de ni sngar gsungs so //
analyzed: nga rgyal nges zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzhan rnams las lhag pa nyid kyis sems kyi mtho ba ni phyir nga rgyal te de ni sngar gsungs so //
translated: Pride is the elevation of the mind due to considering oneself superior to others. It was previously mentioned.

original: 'di ni de'i khyad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i khyad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is its distinction.

original: gang zhig de'i dman pa las mtho ba de ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i dman pa las mtho ba de ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: When one is superior to one's inferiors, that is pride.

original: gang zhig 'dra ba nyid las de shin tu nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dra ba nyid las de shin tu nga rgyal lo //
translated: When one is equal to one's equals, that is excessive pride.

original: gang zhig yang mchog las de ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gang zhig yang mchog las de ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //
translated: When one is superior to one's equals, that is the pride of pride.

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid ma thob pa la bdag gis thob ces bya ba gang zhig sems kyi mtho ba de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid ma thob pa la bdag gis thob ces bya ba gang zhig sems kyi mtho ba de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: When one who has not attained irreversibility claims to have attained it, that elevation of mind is overweening pride.

original: gang zhig yang mi bden pa phyir mi ldog pa'i yon tan rnams kyis bdag ni yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gang zhig yang mi bden pa phyir mi ldog pa'i yon tan rnams kyis bdag ni yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: When one who is not endowed with the qualities of irreversibility claims to be endowed with them, that is false pride.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid dang thun mong ba'i mngon par shes pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ma rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid dang thun mong ba'i mngon par shes pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ma rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Omniscience is the characteristic of non-delusion with regard to the qualities of the superknowledges that are common to the inner self, and the qualities that are uncommon, such as the specific powers.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni ma lus pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten dag la rnam pa kun du yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba ni ma lus pa'i sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten dag la rnam pa kun du yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of an omniscient one is the complete knowledge of the world of sentient beings and the world of the inanimate environment in all its aspects.

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams mthong na zhes bya ba gzhan dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams mthong na zhes bya ba gzhan dang 'brel to //
translated: In this way means in the way just described.

original: lhag ma ni de rnams nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni de rnams nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The rest of the passage is a description of the differences among the three kinds of persons.

original: mi bsnyen pa zhes bya ba ni mtho bas nye bar mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmi bsten zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'gro ba yod na de la mngon @247a * //
analyzed: mi bsnyen pa zhes bya ba ni mtho bas nye bar mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro // mi bsten zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'gro ba yod na de la mngon @247a * //
translated: They do not approach means that they do not approach the great beings because of their loftiness.

original: par mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not attend means that even if they do approach them, they do not delight in them because of their ownüîΩinferiority.

original: 'di la bha dze zhes bya ba bsnyen pa la ae ta dgag pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di la bha dze zhes bya ba bsnyen pa la ae ta dgag pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: In this context, the term bhajya, which is the equivalent of bhakti, does not have the sense of ‚Äúintimate‚Äù because the negative prefix a is not used.

original: ming dang sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'grub pa la mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'grub pa la mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a matter of intimate practice because it is not permanent.

original: bsnyen bkur mi byed ces bya ba ni de la bsnyen bkur nye bar mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur mi byed ces bya ba ni de la bsnyen bkur nye bar mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a matter of service‚Äù because service is not present in it.

original: mi 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi lam rang nyid kyis mkhas par mngon par rlom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi lam rang nyid kyis mkhas par mngon par rlom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a matter of questioning‚Äù because one is not skilled in the path to enlightenment through one‚Äôs own presumption.

original: bdud kyis 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni med pa'i yon tan yang dag par 'byung bas byas pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdud kyis 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni med pa'i yon tan yang dag par 'byung bas byas pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a matter of being bound by Mara‚Äù because one is inflated by the false pride of having attained the qualities of enlightenment.

original: rig par bya ba ni gal te 'di sdig pa nyid kyis bshags par mi byed pa de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa'i rigs dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yod kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la skyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rig par bya ba ni gal te 'di sdig pa nyid kyis bshags par mi byed pa de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa'i rigs dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yod kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la skyes pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a matter of being known‚Äù because, if one does not confess one‚Äôs sins, one is not fit for nirvana, nor is one fit for the bodhisattva way of life, nor is one fit for perfect enlightenment.

original: shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa can la yang nyan thos kyi byang chub dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa can la yang nyan thos kyi byang chub dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For one who desires complete nirvana, there is also the absence of the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and the enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: bdud kyi las kyi skabs su gzhan yang bdud kyi las ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyi skabs su gzhan yang bdud kyi las ston par byed pa ni /
translated: In the context of the activities of MƒÅra, it is also shown to be the activity of MƒÅra.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, Moreover, etc.

original: ming ston pa ni ming brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ming ston pa ni ming brjod pa'o //
translated: The display of names is the expression of names.

original: bdag ni lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis ci ltar shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis ci ltar shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement I am predicted means How do you know?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba dogs nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba dogs nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Why is that? Out of doubt, it is said:

original: de ltar khyod kyi ming zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar khyod kyi ming zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, your name, etc.

original: mngon par bstod pa med pa la zhes pa'i khyad par med par byang chub sems dpa' dang ma la sogs pa'i ming yongs su shes pa mi srid pas zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par bstod pa med pa la zhes pa'i khyad par med par byang chub sems dpa' dang ma la sogs pa'i ming yongs su shes pa mi srid pas zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since it is impossible to know the names of bodhisattvas and mothers, etc. without the distinction of being without praise, that is the intention.

original: rtul ba ni dbang po rtul ba'o //
analyzed: rtul ba ni dbang po rtul ba'o //
translated: Slow is dull.

original: dgon pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan ni bcu gnyis te /üîΩdgon pa la gnas pa yod pas na dgon pa ste /
analyzed: dgon pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan ni bcu gnyis te / dgon pa la gnas pa yod pas na dgon pa ste /
translated: The twelve ascetic practices are living in the forest, and so on.üîΩThe ascetic practice of living in the forest is the antidote to attachment to dwelling in towns.

original: de ring nas brtsams te grong gi nang du gnas pa yongs su gtong bar bya zhing dgon pa la gnas par bya zhes bya ba'i gnyen pos 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ring nas brtsams te grong gi nang du gnas pa yongs su gtong bar bya zhing dgon pa la gnas par bya zhes bya ba'i gnyen pos 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is undertaken with the thought, ‚ÄúFrom this time forth, I will give up dwelling in towns and will live in the forest.‚Äù

original: grong las phyi rol du gang du khyim na gnas pa'i khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba 'brel ba med pa dang sna tshogs pa'i sil snyan dang glu la sogs pa mi thos pa de ni dgon pa'o //
analyzed: grong las phyi rol du gang du khyim na gnas pa'i khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba 'brel ba med pa dang sna tshogs pa'i sil snyan dang glu la sogs pa mi thos pa de ni dgon pa'o //
translated: The forest is any place outside of town where householders and monks do not come and where one does not hear the sounds of various musical instruments and songs.

original: bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i don du grong du mi zhugs par dgon pa la gnas shing yang dag par blangs pa la mgron du bos pa spangs shing bsod snyoms la sbyar bas na bsod snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i don du grong du mi zhugs par dgon pa la gnas shing yang dag par blangs pa la mgron du bos pa spangs shing bsod snyoms la sbyar bas na bsod snyoms pa'o //
translated: The ascetic practice of living on alms is undertaken with the thought, ‚ÄúI will live in the forest and, in order to obtain alms, I will enter the town only for that purpose and will avoid invitations to eat in the homes of laypeople.‚Äù

original: bsod snyoms pa @247b zhes bya ba ni mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa @247b zhes bya ba ni mi 'byung ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúalms‚Äù does not occur in the Sanskrit.

original: 'phel ba la mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slob dpon rnams so //
analyzed: 'phel ba la mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slob dpon rnams so //
translated: The masters say that it is because of impermanence that it increases.

original: pinda ni zas kyi phung po dang 'tsho ba dang slong mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pinda ni zas kyi phung po dang 'tsho ba dang slong mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Pindana means a mass of food, livelihood, and begging.

original: p'a ta ni btung bar byed pa dang rnyed pa thob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: p'a ta ni btung bar byed pa dang rnyed pa thob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Pata means to drink and to obtain gain.

original: bsod snyoms de dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi rigs la slong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsod snyoms de dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi rigs la slong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That alms-food is of inferior, middling, or superior type is called begging.

original: bsod snyoms kyi don du ltung ba la spyod pa'i brtul zhugs 'di la yod pas na bsod snyoms pa ste /
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi don du ltung ba la spyod pa'i brtul zhugs 'di la yod pas na bsod snyoms pa ste /
translated: Because this vow of practice in the fall is in this alms-food, it is called alms-food.

original: ae ka ni byas pas bsod snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: ae ka ni byas pas bsod snyoms pa'o //
translated: Eka means to make, so it is alms-food.

original: yi dam sngon du 'gro bas phyag dar khrod pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na phyag dar khrod pa'o //
analyzed: yi dam sngon du 'gro bas phyag dar khrod pa 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na phyag dar khrod pa'o //
translated: Because this nature of holding the rag-robe is preceded by a vow, it is called the rag-robe.

original: grong dang dur khrod la sogs pa'i phyag dar rnams byed pa mthar thug pa'i gnas gang gis kyang yongs su mi 'dzin pa 'di la yod pas na phyag dar khrod pa'o //
analyzed: grong dang dur khrod la sogs pa'i phyag dar rnams byed pa mthar thug pa'i gnas gang gis kyang yongs su mi 'dzin pa 'di la yod pas na phyag dar khrod pa'o //
translated: He is a refuse-rag wearer because he has no store of any kind of refuse-rag, such as those from a charnel ground, a street, or a rubbish heap.

original: phyag dar bzhin du smad cing 'jig rten na 'gro bas na phyag dar khrod pa ste lam la sogs pa na ltung ba'i gos yongs su bzung ba'o //üîΩphyis yang zas mi za ba'i dang tshul can ni zas phyis mi len pa'o //
analyzed: phyag dar bzhin du smad cing 'jig rten na 'gro bas na phyag dar khrod pa ste lam la sogs pa na ltung ba'i gos yongs su bzung ba'o // phyis yang zas mi za ba'i dang tshul can ni zas phyis mi len pa'o //
translated: He is a refuse-rag wearer because he wears a robe made of rags picked up from a charnel ground, a road, or a rubbish heap, which are despised and discarded by others.üîΩHe is a one-session eater because he does not rise from his seat to eat again.

original: lhag pa'i zas ldog pa de spong bas na zas phyis mi len pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i zas ldog pa de spong bas na zas phyis mi len pa'o //
translated: He is a one-session eater because he rejects eating again after rising from his seat.

original: kha lu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir 'gag pa'i don te /
analyzed: kha lu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'dir 'gag pa'i don te /
translated: The term ‚Äúagain‚Äù means ‚Äúsubsequently.‚Äù

original: mi smra bar byas pa dang ma byas pa zhes bya ba bzhin du'o //üîΩbza' ba thams cad dus gcig nyid du len cing phyis za ba ste /
analyzed: mi smra bar byas pa dang ma byas pa zhes bya ba bzhin du'o // bza' ba thams cad dus gcig nyid du len cing phyis za ba ste /
translated: It is like the expressions ‚Äúhaving stopped speaking‚Äù and ‚Äúnot having stopped speaking.‚ÄùüîΩHe is an after-meals-refuser because he does not accept food after having eaten.

original: za zhing blangs pa ni za bar byed la bza' ba gzhan ni mi len pa'o //
analyzed: za zhing blangs pa ni za bar byed la bza' ba gzhan ni mi len pa'o //
translated: He is an after-meals-refuser because he rejects eating after having eaten.

original: yi dam gyi dbang gis stan gnyis pa za ba'i dus su spangs shing stan gcig la bza' ba'i phyir dang tshul 'di la yod pas na stan gcig pa'o //
analyzed: yi dam gyi dbang gis stan gnyis pa za ba'i dus su spangs shing stan gcig la bza' ba'i phyir dang tshul 'di la yod pas na stan gcig pa'o //
translated: It is called the one-meal ascetic practice because one gives up eating at two times and eats only one meal a day, and because this rule is observed.

original: stan gcig la 'dug nas ci srid yongs su longs spyad par bya ba de srid du yongs su longs spyod par byed cing stan de las langs shing yongs su longs spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stan gcig la 'dug nas ci srid yongs su longs spyad par bya ba de srid du yongs su longs spyod par byed cing stan de las langs shing yongs su longs spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: One sits down on one seat and eats only as much as one needs to satisfy one‚Äôs hunger. One does not get up from that seat until one has finished eating.

original: gzhi ji bzhin pa la gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pa la gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: It is called the as-found ascetic practice because it is the rule to live as one finds things.

original: ji ltar rnyed pa'i sog ma la sogs pa la lan cig ji lta ba nyid du yang dag par gnas pas 'byung ba de nyid du ma la rtag par byed cing yang nas yang du mngon par 'du bya ba'i phyir rtag par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa'i sog ma la sogs pa la lan cig ji lta ba nyid du yang dag par gnas pas 'byung ba de nyid du ma la rtag par byed cing yang nas yang du mngon par 'du bya ba'i phyir rtag par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: One makes do with whatever one finds, such as straw, and one does not make an effort to get better things.

original: chos gos gsum 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na chos gos gsum pa ste snam sbyar @248a * //
analyzed: chos gos gsum 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na chos gos gsum pa ste snam sbyar @248a * //
translated: It is called the three-garment ascetic practice because it is the rule to own only three garments: the patched robe, the upper robe, and the lower robe.

original: dang bla gos dang mthar gos rnams spangs te grogs po'i rnam par rtog pa las kyang chos gos gzhan 'dzin pa so sor spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dang bla gos dang mthar gos rnams spangs te grogs po'i rnam par rtog pa las kyang chos gos gzhan 'dzin pa so sor spangs pa'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who wears the three Dharma robes‚Äù because he has abandoned the upper robe, the lower robe, and the outer robe, and because he does not hold on to any other Dharma robes, even the idea of a friend.

original: dur khrod la gnas pa'i phyir dang tshul 'di la yod pas na dur khrod pa'o //
analyzed: dur khrod la gnas pa'i phyir dang tshul 'di la yod pas na dur khrod pa'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who lives in a charnel ground‚Äù because he lives in a charnel ground and because he has this way of living.

original: ro rnams kyi gnas ma la ni dur khrod de de dang nye ba nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro rnams kyi gnas ma la ni dur khrod de de dang nye ba nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: logs la ltung ba so sor btang zhing 'dug nas lhag par gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na cog pu pa'o //

original: kun nas kun du go skabs ma bkab pa ni blag ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas kun du go skabs ma bkab pa ni blag ba med pa'o //

analyzed: der gnas pa'i phyir dang tshul 'di la yod pas na bla gab med pa'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who lives in the open air‚Äù because he lives in the open air and because he has this way of living.

original: gang zhig sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis 'dzin pa de gzhal yas khang la sogs pa'i gnas so sor spangs pa 'byung zhing nges pa med par dur khrod dang shing drung ngam bla gab med pa la gnas shing ming rnam pa gsum thob pa zhes smra'o //

translated: One who possesses the twelve qualities of training is said to have obtained the three names, because one will be born in a particular place such as a celestial mansion and so on, one will be born in a charnel ground, at the foot of a tree, or in the open, without any fixed abode, and one will be born in a place that is free of the faults of those places.üîΩ

original: bal gyi rang bzhin gyi gos ni phying pa ste /üîΩde 'dzin pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na phying pa pa'o //

translated: One who possesses the twelve ascetic virtues is called a ‚Äúrenouncer‚Äù because he has renounced the special places such as the celestial mansion, etc., and he is called a ‚Äúwearer of felt‚Äù because he has the nature of wearing felt, which is a woolen garment.

original: 'dod pa nyung ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan ci snyed pa rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa 'byung ba 'dod pa nyung ba nyid dang por byas nas de rnams kyis ci zhig de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa zhes pha rol po rnams kyis shes
analyzed: 'dod pa nyung ba zhes bya ba ni yon tan ci snyed pa rnams dang yang dag par ldan pa 'byung ba 'dod pa nyung ba nyid dang por byas nas de rnams kyis ci zhig de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa zhes pha rol po rnams kyis shes
translated: He is called ‚Äúone of few desires‚Äù because he is endowed with few desires, i.e., with the virtues of fewness of wishes, etc., and he is called ‚Äúone who is content with what he has‚Äù because he is endowed with the virtue of contentment.

original: par ma gyur cig ces de rnams kyis gzhan las shes pa yang dag par rjes su tshol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: par ma gyur cig ces de rnams kyis gzhan las shes pa yang dag par rjes su tshol ba ma yin no //

analyzed: chog shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan las gzhan gyi chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa rnams kyis chog shes pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu 'chab pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i 'don pa'o //

original: de ni shin tu yang ma 'brel te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnas skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'jam por smra ba ni mnyes gshin pa'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la skye ba 'di @248b nyid la 'byung ba ni tshe 'di'o //

analyzed: nges bstan par 'gyur ba'o //

original: ci lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa ni sngon yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni sngon yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the past, he possessed these ascetic practices.üîΩWhen cotton or wool is not yet cleaned, it is not properly cleaned, and at that time it is not soft when properly worn, and it is not workable for the production of felt and so on.üîΩWhen it is cleaned and well cleaned, it is workable.

analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan 'di dag dang ldan par gyur to zhes bya ba ni bal lam ras bal dus gang gi tshe ma sbyangs par gyur pa dang yang dag par sbyangs par gyur pa ma yin pa dang / de'i tshe yang dag par bgos pa 'jam pa ma yin pa spun mngon par 'grub pa la sogs pa las su mi rung ba gang gi tshe yang sbyangs pa dang rnam par sbyangs pa de'i tshe las su rung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du gya nom pa dang

analyzed: des rlom sems bskyed par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de la gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni ci ltar gsungs pa'i lam la rab tu gnas pa rnams kyis so //

analyzed: ming gi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: ming ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sgra dang de'i phyir yon tan gyi sgra'o //

analyzed: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste go sla ba nyid do //

analyzed: khengs pas zil gyis non pa zhes bya ba la khengs pa ni yon tan lhag pa rnams la ma gus pa'o //

analyzed: yang gtso bo'i don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pas bdud kyi las don du gsungs pa ni / gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the statement that the deeds of Mara are for the sake of the perfection of the meaning of the principal matter isüîΩas follows:üîΩAnd further, that name...

original: ming de gang yin pa zhes de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ming de gang yin pa zhes de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

analyzed: des gang sems kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: By that thought...

original: des zhes bya ba @249a * //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba @249a * //
translated: By that

analyzed: ni byang chub sems dpas so // rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means by the bodhisattva.üîΩFollowing

analyzed: 'di nyid la 'og ma dag gis rgyas par bshad pa ni rjes su brtags shing zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni yang dag par go ba'o //

analyzed: gang gis gang mtshungs par byed ce na /

analyzed: gsungs pa ni lung bstan to zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: sbyangs shing dul bar gyur nas zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro de dang de rnams las bskyod nas so //
translated: Having been refined and disciplined means having been moved from those and those miserable realms.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan la'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan la'o //

original: de yang skye ba gzhan la 'byung ba'i mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa nyid dus shin tu ring ba dang dka' bas mngon par 'dod pa'i don yang dag par sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //

translated: And that is the desire to fully awaken to highest genuine enlightenment that occurs in another birth, which will accomplish the aim that is fully desired, even though it is very distant in time and difficult.

original: gal te skye ba de nyid la byas pa'i las de nyid du gnyen po bsten pa byas par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te skye ba de nyid la byas pa'i las de nyid du gnyen po bsten pa byas par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: If the karma that was done in that very birth is countered by the application of an antidote, it is said that the karma that was done will not be wasted.

original: bdag gis dngos po thob pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gis dngos po thob pa de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The term that very thing is used because of the attainment of that very thing.

original: sems bskyed pa de dag ces byas ni nga rgyal la sogs pas ba rgyan pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de dag ces byas ni nga rgyal la sogs pas ba rgyan pa rnams so //

analyzed: rnam pa smod par 'gyur ba ni smod pa'i gnyen pos so //

analyzed: byang bar byed par 'gyur ba ni kun du spyod pa'i gnyen pos so //
translated: They become purified by means of the antidote of complete knowledge.

original: gnong bar 'gyur ba ni rang dang gzhan la ltos pa'i ngo tsha bas so //
analyzed: gnong bar 'gyur ba ni rang dang gzhan la ltos pa'i ngo tsha bas so //
translated: They become remorseful by means of the antidotes of shame and abashment, which are based on oneself and others, respectively.

original: 'dor bar 'gyur ba ni rten gyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: 'dor bar 'gyur ba ni rten gyi stobs kyis so //

original: so sor 'chags par 'gyur ba ni slar mi byed pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: so sor 'chags par 'gyur ba ni slar mi byed pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa 'dzin pas so //
translated: They confess individually by means of the vow not to commit the offense again, etc.

original: rnyed par dka' zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal bas thob par bya ba ste yang mi thob pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnyed par dka' zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal bas thob par bya ba ste yang mi thob pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is difficult to obtain because it is obtained through suffering, but not because it is never obtained again.

original: rnam pa mang ba'i gnyen po rjes su tshol ba dang lan cig gnyen po nye bar ltung ba ci zhig nus pa med pa yin nam zhe na /üîΩbden mod kyi /

translated: But if one seeks the antidote to the many forms of the mental afflictions, and if the antidote does not descend upon one, what can one do?

original: thabs chung ba la nus pa shin tu che ba la ni ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: thabs chung ba la nus pa shin tu che ba la ni ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is not said that the effect is small when the cause is small, or that the effect is great when the cause is great.üîΩThe sutra says,

original: de srid du ches lci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de srid du ches lci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is very heavy as long as it is heavy,‚Äù and so on.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa can zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa nyid la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa rnam pa bdun las ldang ba'i cho ga dang de rnam par dag pa'i cho ga dang nyams pa'i cho @249b ga gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose of the sravaka vehicle‚Äù refers to the seven types of pratimoksa vows that arise from the sravaka vehicle itself, because the ritual for taking them, the ritual for purifying them and the ritual for their degeneration are taught.

original: nyan thos kyis la zhes bya ba ni de ni dge slong gi sdom pa gzung ba gal te nyan thos kyis nyid la slob par 'dod par 'gyur ba nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas de'i tshe ma thob pa yongs su nyams pas skye ba
analyzed: nyan thos kyis la zhes bya ba ni de ni dge slong gi sdom pa gzung ba gal te nyan thos kyis nyid la slob par 'dod par 'gyur ba nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas de'i tshe ma thob pa yongs su nyams pas skye ba
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the sravaka vehicle‚Äù means that if one who has taken the vow of a fully ordained monk wishes to train in the sravaka vehicle, then when he obtains the nirvana of the sravaka, at that time the vow arises through obtaining what was not previously obtained and through degeneration.

original: de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnam las yongs su nyams pa dang lhar dge sbyong gi sdom pa 'dzin pa la skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir de'i zad pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnam las yongs su nyams pa dang lhar dge sbyong gi sdom pa 'dzin pa la skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir de'i zad pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: and the great exhaustion of that is the degeneration of the result of virtue.

original: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa'i rtsa ba'i ltung ba de rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa nyams pa yang yod pa 'di ni rnam par nges par bsdu ba las dpyad par bya ste /

translated: Moreover, if the bodhisattva vows are impaired by the root downfalls of bodhisattvas, this is to be analyzed in the Compendium of Ascertainment.

original: de ltar na yang slar 'di dge bsnyen la sogs pa'i sdom pa bzung nas byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dge sbyong gi 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa ni de la mngon par 'dod pa nyid de /
