original: nyan thos kyi byang chub las mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang grangs med pa gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir de bas na de la zad pa chen po ni med ces bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩnyan thos kyis la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub las mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang grangs med pa gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir de bas na de la zad pa chen po ni med ces bstan pa'i phyir / nyan thos kyis la zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Because they do not seek the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, and because they must accomplish complete enlightenment by three incalculable aeons, it is said that they do not have the great exhaustion.

original: bzhi zhes bya ba ni mi gsod pa dang / k'ar sh'a pa na'i bzhi cha rku ba dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mi'i chos bla ma smra ba zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: bzhi zhes bya ba ni mi gsod pa dang / k'ar sh'a pa na'i bzhi cha rku ba dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mi'i chos bla ma smra ba zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: The four are: killing a human, stealing four kƒÅr·π£ƒÅpa·πáas, impure conduct, and falsely claiming to have transcended worldly dharmas.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fundamental downfalls are so called because they lack the activity of antidotes.

original: dge slong ma yin zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa las nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma yin zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa las nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is not a bhik·π£u means one has fallen from the vows of a bhik·π£u.

original: dge sbyong ma yin zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnams ma thob cing yongs su nyams pas so //
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnams ma thob cing yongs su nyams pas so //
translated: One is not an ascetic means one has not attained the fruits of an ascetic and has fallen away.

original: sh'akya'i sras po ma yin ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa 'dzin pa la skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras po ma yin ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa 'dzin pa la skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not a son of the ≈öƒÅkyas means that he is not worthy of the vows of a monk.

original: phra mo phra ba dag ces bya ba ni mtshon par bya dka' ba rnams so //
analyzed: phra mo phra ba dag ces bya ba ni mtshon par bya dka' ba rnams so //
translated: The phrase the most subtle means that they are difficult to discern.

original: slar rnam par dben par snang ba'i yon tan nye bar bstan pas bdud kyi las gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: slar rnam par dben par snang ba'i yon tan nye bar bstan pas bdud kyi las gsungs pa ni //
translated: The statement about the deeds of MƒÅra is made in order to show the virtues of the appearance of solitude.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase Moreover, etc., refers to the second.

original: dgon pa dang nags 'dab dang ri'i phug dang dur khrod dang bas mtha'i gnas mal dag na gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dgon pa dang nags 'dab dang ri'i phug dang dur khrod dang bas mtha'i gnas mal dag na gnas pa dang zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase living in a forest, in the open, in a remote place, in a charnel ground, or in a hermitage refers to the second.

original: dben pa'o zhes nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba la dben pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dben pa'o zhes nga mi smra'o zhes bya ba la dben pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The phrase I do not say that he is solitary means that there are two kinds of solitude.

original: lus dben pa dang sems dben pa'o //üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems dben pa nyid gtso @250a * //
analyzed: lus dben pa dang sems dben pa'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems dben pa nyid gtso @250a * //
translated: There is solitude of the body and solitude of the mind.

original: bo zhes gtso bo'i don to //
analyzed: bo zhes gtso bo'i don to //
translated: The phrase the solitude of the mind of the bodhisattvas is preeminent means that the solitude of the mind is preeminent.

original: dgon pa dang zhes bya ba ni dgon pa las 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: dgon pa dang zhes bya ba ni dgon pa las 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The phrase in a forest means in a forest grove.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bas mtha'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bas mtha'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a remote place.

original: yul mi med pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo rnams kyis dben pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: yul mi med pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo rnams kyis dben pa'i gnas so //
translated: A place without people is a place free from crowds.

original: nags 'dab ni stong pa rnams so //
analyzed: nags 'dab ni stong pa rnams so //
translated: A forest is a place that is empty.

original: dben pa ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: dben pa ni bral ba'o //
translated: Solitude is freedom from attachment.

original: grong gi nang ni nye ba'am phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: grong gi nang ni nye ba'am phyogs gcig go //
translated: In a village is a place that is close or a place that is in one direction.

original: yid la byed pa dag gis dben pa zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa dag gis dben pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dag gis dben pa zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa dag gis dben pa'o //
translated: Solitude through attention is solitude through attention.

original: brten pa ni mngon par zhen pa chung bas so //
analyzed: brten pa ni mngon par zhen pa chung bas so //
translated: One who is settled is one who has little attachment.

original: zhen pa ni 'bring gis so //
analyzed: zhen pa ni 'bring gis so //
translated: One who is attached is one who has medium attachment.

original: chags pa ni chen pos so //
analyzed: chags pa ni chen pos so //
translated: One who is passionate is one who has great attachment.

original: lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa ni bdag nyid la de nyid kyis bstod pas so //üîΩ'dres par gnas pa ni khyim pa dang rab tu 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa ni bdag nyid la de nyid kyis bstod pas so // 'dres par gnas pa ni khyim pa dang rab tu 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: One who is very passionate is one who praises himself with that very thing.üîΩOne who lives mixed is one who lives with householders and renunciates.

original: kun du 'dres pa ni rab tu 'byung ba rnams nyid kyis so //
analyzed: kun du 'dres pa ni rab tu 'byung ba rnams nyid kyis so //
translated: One who lives crowded is one who lives with many renunciates.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gdol ba ni de rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gdol ba ni de rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A bodhisattva outcast is one who does not live with them.

original: sun 'byin pa ni rang gi skyon gyis de rnams la sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni rang gi skyon gyis de rnams la sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The refutation is because of refuting them by one's own faults.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan ni rnam par ma dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan ni rnam par ma dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams la slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reflection of a Bodhisattva is because of training in the impure dharmas of a Bodhisattva.

original: bcos bu ni rnam pa gang gis yang 'dra ba tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bcos bu ni rnam pa gang gis yang 'dra ba tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: The imitation is because of mere similarity in some aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sred ni rtsva'i rigs kyi bye brag lo tog rlag par byed pa de bzhin du 'di yang theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sred ni rtsva'i rigs kyi bye brag lo tog rlag par byed pa de bzhin du 'di yang theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The craving of a Bodhisattva is like a particular kind of grass that destroys the harvest, and this is also like that.

original: dge sbyong gi cha byad du 'chos pa chom rkun pa'o zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi cha byad kyi chos ma yin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi cha byad du 'chos pa chom rkun pa'o zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi cha byad kyi chos ma yin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thief in the guise of an ascetic is because of holding the dharmas that are not the guise of an ascetic.

original: chos rkun pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rkun pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thief of the Dharma is because of not wanting the Bodhisattvas.

original: lhag dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi chom rkun pa ni log par mchod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi chom rkun pa ni log par mchod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The world is a thief with a remainder, because it is a false object of worship.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas de lta bu la dam pa rnams kyis bsten par bya ba ma yin pa nyid rgyas par gsungs so /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas de lta bu la dam pa rnams kyis bsten par bya ba ma yin pa nyid rgyas par gsungs so /
translated: Such a nature, etc.

original: mthu ni stobs so //
analyzed: mthu ni stobs so //
translated: Power is strength.

original: slob dpon dang mi ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon dang mi ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not having a teacher is being devoid of a spiritual friend.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni sdig pa can no //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa ni sdig pa can no //
translated: Not noble is sinful.

original: der yang re zhig ces bya ba ni de lta bu la yang ste sems can thams cad la lta ci smos //
analyzed: der yang re zhig ces bya ba ni de lta bu la yang ste sems can thams cad la lta ci smos //
translated: There, also, for a while is even in that way, what to say about all sentient beings.üîΩWith a loving mind, etc.

original: byams pa'i yid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas byams pa la sogs pa bzhi yul gyi dbye bas gsungs so //
analyzed: byams pa'i yid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas byams pa la sogs pa bzhi yul gyi dbye bas gsungs so //
translated: Loving, etc. is the four immeasurables, distinguished by their objects.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas smon lam @250b mo ;
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas smon lam @250b mo ;
translated: Thus, etc.

original: ;'di yang zhes bya ba ni gang gi 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: ;'di yang zhes bya ba ni gang gi 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad do //
translated: This also is all of what was said beginning with this also.

original: mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ste /
translated: By means of the superknowledges means by means of the five superknowledges.

original: pha rol gnon pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gnon pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i bya ba'o //
translated: The heroic mind is the activity of the person.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi ma'i bdud kyi las nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi ma'i bdud kyi las nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The summary of the future deeds of Mara is stated in this also, etc.

original: bdud kyi las rnams mngon par brjod pa'i le'u ni bdud kyi le'u ste le'u nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o /
analyzed: bdud kyi las rnams mngon par brjod pa'i le'u ni bdud kyi le'u ste le'u nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o /
translated: The chapter that reveals the deeds of Mara is the Chapter on Mara, the twenty-first.

original: // / da ni sngar zab mo'i gnas gang zhig gsungs pa de rtogs pa ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid do //üîΩbdud kyi las shes pa yang 'di thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa de bas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: // / da ni sngar zab mo'i gnas gang zhig gsungs pa de rtogs pa ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid do // bdud kyi las shes pa yang 'di thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa de bas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, the realization of the profound points taught above is the state of irreversibility.

original: rab 'byor 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: And the knowledge of the deeds of Mara is that all of this depends on the spiritual teacher. Therefore, the reliance on the spiritual teacher is stated in Subhuti, here, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral bas ci ltar shin tu che ba 'di lta bu rang don dang gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rab kyi mthar brten pa'i tshogs ci ltar zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral bas ci ltar shin tu che ba 'di lta bu rang don dang gzhan don phun sum tshogs pa thams cad rab kyi mthar brten pa'i tshogs ci ltar zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: How can a Bodhisattva who is separated from a spiritual teacher attain such a great perfection of his own and others' aims, which is based on the highest of accumulations? This is the intention.

original: dang po kho nar zhes bya ba ste gzhan du na bag med par ltung ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyan  par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po kho nar zhes bya ba ste gzhan du na bag med par ltung ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyan  par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At the very outset means that otherwise he would fall into heedlessness and would not be able to approach a spiritual teacher.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid dang zhes bya ba ni de rnams la bla na med pa'i chos bstan par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyid dang zhes bya ba ni de rnams la bla na med pa'i chos bstan par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas themselves means that they teach the unsurpassed Dharma to them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni 'og ma'i sa la gnas pa rnams las gong ma'i sa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni 'og ma'i sa la gnas pa rnams las gong ma'i sa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas means those who are on the higher stages, in contrast to those on the lower stages.

original: 'ga' zhig tu byang chub sems dpa'i sems la mkhas pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu byang chub sems dpa'i sems la mkhas pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: In some places it is recited as skill in the thought of the Bodhisattvas.

original: de la sems la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi rgyu ba la ma rmongs pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa gdams ngag bstan par nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la sems la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi rgyu ba la ma rmongs pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa gdams ngag bstan par nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattva who is skilled in mind, who is not confused about the movement of mind, is able to teach the perfections to the bodhisattvas. This is the meaning.

original: las dang po pa'i thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes par 'dod par gyur pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams so //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes par 'dod par gyur pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams so //
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas are the spiritual benefactors for the beginner who wishes to know the nature of listening and so on.

original: gang zhig thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa bsgom pa mngon par sbyor ba de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dge ba'i bshes gnyen no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa bsgom pa mngon par sbyor ba de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dge ba'i bshes gnyen no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is the spiritual benefactor for one who is engaged in meditation, who has completed the knowledge that is the nature of listening and reflection.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pu bsgrub par bya ba'i byang chub ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pu bsgrub par bya ba'i byang chub ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that enlightenment is to be accomplished by the perfection of wisdom alone.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba la de med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni /üîΩthams @251a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba la de med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni / thams @251a * //
translated: Because it does not exist for those who are devoid of the perfection of means, such as generosity.

original: cad nyid ces bya ba la ci ltar de gcig pu de ltar tshogs pa drug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cad nyid ces bya ba la ci ltar de gcig pu de ltar tshogs pa drug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: All means that, just as it is one, it is also six collections.

original: de rnams nyid mthar phyin pa rang gi ngo bo yang dag par bstan pas rjes su bstan pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams nyid mthar phyin pa rang gi ngo bo yang dag par bstan pas rjes su bstan pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: It is the teacher because it teaches by demonstrating the nature of the perfection of those very [perfections].

original: de las snga rol du de nyid ni lam mo //
analyzed: de las snga rol du de nyid ni lam mo //
translated: Prior to that, it is the path.

original: snang ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rab tu dga' ba la de rnams nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rab tu dga' ba la de rnams nyid do //
translated: The light is the supramundane wisdom of the Joyful Ground, which is those very [perfections].

original: sgron ma ni 'bad pas rgyu'i lam la dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa drug la de rnams nyid do //
analyzed: sgron ma ni 'bad pas rgyu'i lam la dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i sa drug la de rnams nyid do //
translated: The lamp is the stainless grounds such as Stainless, which are the path of exertion and cause.

original: 'od ni nyin par snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'od ni nyin par snang ba'o //
translated: The radiance is the daytime light.

original: de yang 'bad pa med par rgyu ba'i lam mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams la de nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'bad pa med par rgyu ba'i lam mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams la de nyid do //
translated: That is also the very [perfection] on the grounds such as Immovable, which are the path of effortless movement.

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la ltung ba las yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa la ltung ba las yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word protector is used because it protects one from falling into the stages of the disciples and so on.

original: skyabs zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyabs zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word refuge is used because it accomplishes all the practices of the bodhisattva.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i bde ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i bde ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word support is used because it is the basis of unsurpassed happiness.

original: dpung gnyen zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpung gnyen zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ally is used because it is the basis for attaining omniscience through its unique qualities.

original: gling zhes bya ba ni de la brten pa rnams la nyon mongs pa'i rgya mtshos zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gling zhes bya ba ni de la brten pa rnams la nyon mongs pa'i rgya mtshos zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word continent is used because those who rely on it are not overwhelmed by the ocean of afflictions.

original: ma ni 'dzin pa'i phyir dang gso ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ni 'dzin pa'i phyir dang gso ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word mother is used because it holds and nourishes.

original: pha ni sa bon gtod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha ni sa bon gtod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word father is used because it transmits the seed.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word knowledge is used because it sees.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word realization is used because it is the path of cultivation.

original: de zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ston pa la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ston pa la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The that is because of the very teaching, etc. of the six perfections.

original: rab 'byor 'di la zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brten pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brten pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, Subhuti, it is based on the six perfections means based on the six perfections.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la mchog gi 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid la mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la mchog gi 'bras bu sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid la mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is the supreme result of the perfections such as giving, since it is the final goal of the Buddha's characteristics.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid pha rol tu phyin pa drug las skyes pa zhes brjod pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid pha rol tu phyin pa drug las skyes pa zhes brjod pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement that the omniscience of the Buddhas of the three times is born from the six perfections is stated:

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The past Buddhas, etc.

original: de bas kyang 'di rnams la ston pa la sogs pa nyid rigs zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang 'di rnams la ston pa la sogs pa nyid rigs zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that therefore it is reasonable that they are the very teaching, etc. of these.

original: skyes pa ni grub pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa ni grub pa'o //
translated: Born means accomplished.

original: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub sgrub par nus pa mngon sum gyi 'bras bu la brten pa nyid kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub sgrub par nus pa mngon sum gyi 'bras bu la brten pa nyid kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the direct result of the power to accomplish the perfect enlightenment of the Tathagatas of the three times is based on the perfections, he says:

original: nga yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nga yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I also, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dbye bas byang chub kyi lam rnam pa mang @251b pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i dbye bas byang chub kyi lam rnam pa mang @251b pa ste /
translated: Why is that? The path of enlightenment is manifold, due to the divisions of the factors of enlightenment, etc.

original: de bas na ci ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug las byung ba'i byang chub ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ci ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug las byung ba'i byang chub ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, how is it that enlightenment arises from the six perfections? This is the idea.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba thams cad bsdus pa las byung ba'i phyir ci rigs par thams cad 'di rnams nyid la bsdu ba zhes gsungs pa ni 'di dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sangs rgyas kyi ye
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba thams cad bsdus pa las byung ba'i phyir ci rigs par thams cad 'di rnams nyid la bsdu ba zhes gsungs pa ni 'di dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sangs rgyas kyi ye
translated: Since all the causes and results of the perfections are included in the arising of the perfections, he says that everything is included in them, as appropriate.

original: shes la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: shes la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: The words of the Buddha's gnosis, etc. have already been explained.

original: sems can thams cad la yang de phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa mthong nas pha rol po rnams la rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang de phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa mthong nas pha rol po rnams la rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having seen the practice of generosity, etc., in others, one generates the thought of complete enlightenment, etc.

original: da ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi gtso bo nyid gsungs pa ni /üîΩ'di dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi gtso bo nyid gsungs pa ni / 'di dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the preeminence of the perfection of wisdom itself is stated:üîΩHerein, the perfection of wisdom is the foremost for one who desires to train.üîΩOne who desires to train is one who has set out for the Great Vehicle.

original: slob par 'dod pa ni bslab pa thams cad kyi nang nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon du 'gro ba ste mngon par rdzogs par byang chub kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob par 'dod pa ni bslab pa thams cad kyi nang nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon du 'gro ba ste mngon par rdzogs par byang chub kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is foremost among all the trainings, because it is the cause of full enlightenment.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is stated:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'jug pa la rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad 'jug pa la rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Foremost means that it is the cause of the engagement of all the perfections.

original: 'dren pa'o zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dren pa'o zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The leader is because of the teaching of the truth to the ignorant.

original: rab tu 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la rab yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la rab yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The good leader is because of the excellence of that.

original: yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dman pa rnams la yang dag pa'i gzi brjid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dman pa rnams la yang dag pa'i gzi brjid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teacher of the truth is because of the possession of the true splendor for those of weak effort.

original: kun du ston pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas shes pa'i don ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: kun du ston pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas shes pa'i don ston par byed pa ste /
translated: The demonstrator is because of the demonstration of the meaning of the knowledge of all things.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inspirer is because of the arousing of the delight of those who have entered the true way.

original: skyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang po rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang po rtogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The mother is because of the generation of the lineage of the Tathagata through the realization of the first stage.

original: ma ma'o zhes bya ba ni dang por khong du chud pa nyid nas gong nas gong du yang dag par 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ma'o zhes bya ba ni dang por khong du chud pa nyid nas gong nas gong du yang dag par 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nurse is because of the constant association with the higher and higher stages.

original: de lta bas na gang gi phyir 'di nyid 'dren pa rab tu 'dren pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi phyir 'di nyid 'dren pa rab tu 'dren pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste lta bas na'o //
translated: Therefore, because of this, he says, ‚ÄúThis very perfection of wisdom is the leader, the best leader, etc. ‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing 'gro bar 'dod na zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing 'gro bar 'dod na zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one wishes to go without relying on another‚Äù is on the stage of action in faith.

original: gnas par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa thob pa la gong nas gong du khyad par thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa thob pa la gong nas gong du khyad par thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one wishes to stand‚Äù is for one who has attained realization, in order to attain higher and higher distinctions.üîΩ‚ÄúOne should train in just this perfection of wisdom‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes bya bas zhar la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid gang lags zhes bya bas 'dri bar byed @252a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes bya bas zhar la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid gang lags zhes bya bas 'dri bar byed @252a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the defining characteristic of the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù is the question.

original: pa ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe defining characteristic of nonattachment‚Äù is the answer.

original: nam mkha' ltar thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The defining characteristic of space is unobstructedness, because it does not apprehend the intrinsic defining characteristics of all phenomena.

original: sngar ni bdud kyi las la sogs pa rnams kyis thogs pa nye bar bstan pas so //
analyzed: sngar ni bdud kyi las la sogs pa rnams kyis thogs pa nye bar bstan pas so //
translated: Previously, it was shown that they are obstructed by the activities of MƒÅra, and so on.

original: da ni don dam par thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni chos thams cad ni dben pa'o chos thams cad ni stong pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ni don dam par thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni chos thams cad ni dben pa'o chos thams cad ni stong pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Now, the characteristic of ultimate non-obstruction is stated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena are void, all phenomena are empty.‚Äù

original: kun brtags kyi chos rnams kyis dben pa nyid yongs su grub pa'i chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yin na de bas na de dag stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi chos rnams kyis dben pa nyid yongs su grub pa'i chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yin na de bas na de dag stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The very essence of all phenomena that are fully accomplished is the voidness of all phenomena that are imagined. Therefore, the meaning is that they are empty.

original: rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di 'dri bar byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa dang stong pa yin na phyis dben par 'gyur ba ma yin te phyis kyang stong par bya ba ma yin
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di 'dri bar byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa dang stong pa yin na phyis dben par 'gyur ba ma yin te phyis kyang stong par bya ba ma yin
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, if‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on is asked in order to clarify this. ‚ÄúBlessed One, if all phenomena are void and empty by their very essence, then they are not void later on, and they are not made empty later on.

original: no // 'o na de ltar dben pa dang stong pa de rnams la ci ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa dang ci ltar rnam par byang ba zhes 'dri bar byed pa ni de ci snyam du sems /
analyzed: no // 'o na de ltar dben pa dang stong pa de rnams la ci ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa dang ci ltar rnam par byang ba zhes 'dri bar byed pa ni de ci snyam du sems /
translated: What is the afflictive and what is the purification in those voidnesses and emptinesses?

original: sems can rnams yun ring po nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams yun ring po nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning ‚ÄúFor a long time sentient beings‚Äù is as follows.

original: gal te yang chos thams cad dben pa dang stong pa yin na de ltar yang byis pa rnams dben pa nyid dang stong pa nyid de mi shes pa'i skyon gyis phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa dag gis chags
analyzed: gal te yang chos thams cad dben pa dang stong pa yin na de ltar yang byis pa rnams dben pa nyid dang stong pa nyid de mi shes pa'i skyon gyis phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa dag gis chags
translated: If all phenomena are voidness and emptiness, still, due to the fault of not understanding voidness and emptiness, childish beings are attached to all phenomena such as the five aggregates, grasping them as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: par 'gyur te chags pa yang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa la brtson par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur te chags pa yang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa la brtson par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are attached and strive to create the manifest actions of merit and demerit.

original: de'i dbang gis 'khor bar kun nas rgyug cing kun nas 'khor ba nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'khor bar kun nas rgyug cing kun nas 'khor ba nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, one is completely driven around in cyclic existence, and is completely afflicted by the afflictions and by the afflictions of karma.

original: de ltar mi shes pa'i skyon gyis kun nas nyon mongs par rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mi shes pa'i skyon gyis kun nas nyon mongs par rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the fault of not knowing is the cause of affliction.

original: de dag phyis gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnyed pas thos pa dang bsam pa'i dbang gis bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag phyis gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnyed pas thos pa dang bsam pa'i dbang gis bden pa'i mtshan nyid dang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, when one finds a spiritual friend, through the power of hearing and reflection, one will understand the characteristics of the truths and the characteristics of emptiness.

original: de'i tshe skad cig tu gsungs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas mi ba bskyod pa'i phyir rim gyis kun brtags kyi chos rnams yongs su gyur ba la rnam par byang ba rab tu 'du shes so //üîΩ'dzin pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe skad cig tu gsungs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pas mi ba bskyod pa'i phyir rim gyis kun brtags kyi chos rnams yongs su gyur ba la rnam par byang ba rab tu 'du shes so // 'dzin pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: At that time, because one is not shaken by the afflictions that are said to be momentary, one gradually transforms the imagined dharmas and fully understands purification.üîΩGrasping is grasping at signs.

original: mngon par chags pa ni dngos po nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa ni dngos po nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Attachment is grasping at things as real.

original: mi brdzi @252b ba zhes bya ba ni dbrog par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi brdzi @252b ba zhes bya ba ni dbrog par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase not to be overcome means not to be taken away.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod pa zil gyis non pa ste de'i spyod pa la rang gi don tsam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod pa zil gyis non pa ste de'i spyod pa la rang gi don tsam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the overcoming of the conduct of the Sravakas, etc. because their conduct is limited to their own welfare.

original: don gsungs pa la brtan par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba ni /
analyzed: don gsungs pa la brtan par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba ni /
translated: The Lord's permission to Subhuti to speak about the meaning of the perfection of wisdom is stated in order to stabilize the meaning that has been taught.

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: It is just as you have said and so on.

original: da ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la spyod pa med pa brjod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang 'di'i spyod pa yang don med pa zhes rlom sems su byed pa rnams kyi de'i dogs pa bsal ba'i don du bsod nams mang baüîΩnyid dang de'i rgyu gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la spyod pa med pa brjod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang 'di'i spyod pa yang don med pa zhes rlom sems su byed pa rnams kyi de'i dogs pa bsal ba'i don du bsod nams mang ba nyid dang de'i rgyu gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to remove the doubt of those who think that the perfection of wisdom is also a useless activity for him because it is said that he has no activity in regard to phenomena such as form, the Lord states the great merit and its cause.

original: yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If, Subhuti, a son or daughter of good family and so on.

original: ci srid 'tsho'i bar du gnas shing zhes bya ba ni tshe ci srid du'o //
analyzed: ci srid 'tsho'i bar du gnas shing zhes bya ba ni tshe ci srid du'o //
translated: For as long as they live means for as long as their lives last.

original: sbyin pa de yang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa de yang zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la'o //
translated: That generosity is to all the Buddhas and all the Bodhisattvas.

original: mang ngo zhes bya ba ni sems can gcig la yang bsod nams de mang na mang po rnams la ni re zhig lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: mang ngo zhes bya ba ni sems can gcig la yang bsod nams de mang na mang po rnams la ni re zhig lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: It is much is in comparison with the merit of one sentient being, much more so in comparison with many.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They become the field of merit means they attain the status of the unsurpassed field of merit.

original: ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni dor bar byas nas so //
analyzed: ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni dor bar byas nas so //
translated: Except means having excluded.

original: de de rnams kyis ma gtogs pa ni ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
analyzed: de de rnams kyis ma gtogs pa ni ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
translated: Why is it that they are excluded?

original: gang zag bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu shin tu thabs cig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu shin tu thabs cig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the unsurpassed persons are the Bodhisattvas, who are the unsurpassed persons, because they are the unsurpassed field of merit.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /üîΩ'on kyang rdul phran sa la ni //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / 'on kyang rdul phran sa la ni //
translated: As it is said:üîΩEven though the merit of the Buddhas

original: ba lang rjes dang rgya mtsho yi //
analyzed: ba lang rjes dang rgya mtsho yi //
translated: is like the footprints of a cow in the earth,

original: khyad par dag ni gang yin pa //üîΩsangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: khyad par dag ni gang yin pa // sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: What is the difference?üîΩThe difference between the Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas

original: khyad par dag ni de yin no //üîΩgsad par bya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: khyad par dag ni de yin no // gsad par bya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni //
translated: is just this.

original: gsad par bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsad par bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be killed‚Äù means to be in the position of being killed.

original: mi khom par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thob par gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi khom par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thob par gyur pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be in an unfavorable state‚Äù means to be in a state of not having attained.

original: skyo ba chen po zhes bya ba ni shin tu sems can rnams la dga' ba nyid kyis myur du sdug bsngal las 'don pa'i skyo ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyo ba chen po zhes bya ba ni shin tu sems can rnams la dga' ba nyid kyis myur du sdug bsngal las 'don pa'i skyo ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat compassion‚Äù means that, because of their great love for sentient beings, they are quickly moved to rescue them from suffering.

original: yid la byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyob par byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yid la byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyob par byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be mentally engaged‚Äù means to be engaged in protecting.

original: de gsungs pa ni sdug ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni sdug ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúsuffering, etc.‚Äù

original: sbyin pa chen po zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rang gi lag gis sbyin pa de rnams kyi sbyin pa po ste gang zhig gzhan gyis sbyin pa byed du bcug pa de rnams 'byor ba'i bdag po ste sbyin pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rang gi lag gis sbyin pa de rnams kyi sbyin pa po ste gang zhig gzhan gyis sbyin pa byed du bcug pa de rnams 'byor ba'i bdag po ste sbyin pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: The great giver is the one who gives with his own hand. The one who gives through others is the one who gives through others. The one who gives through others is the master of wealth, the lord of giving.

original: 'bras bu yod pa ni 'bras bu dang @253a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa ni 'bras bu dang @253a * //
translated: The one with results is the one with results.

original: bcas pa'o // yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms zhes bya ba ni yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms so //
analyzed: bcas pa'o // yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms zhes bya ba ni yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms so //
translated: The alms of the country is the alms of the country.

original: gsungs pa dpes gsal bar byed pa ni 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩnor bu rin po che shes pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de brtag pa'i bstan bcos yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa dpes gsal bar byed pa ni 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / nor bu rin po che shes pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de brtag pa'i bstan bcos yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation by example is as follows: It is like this, for example.üîΩThe one who knows the precious jewel is the one who knows the treatise on its examination.

original: nor bu rin po che'i rigs shes pas zhes bya ba ni mtshon par bya ba la yongs su 'dris pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i rigs shes pas zhes bya ba ni mtshon par bya ba la yongs su 'dris pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who knows the type of the precious jewel is the one who is familiar with what is to be indicated.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de srid du btsal bar bya zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de srid du btsal bar bya zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //

translated: Then, the Lord, in order to show that the Bodhisattva, because of being isolated and empty, the nature of the Dharma Body, does not exist, that is, does not arise, in that, by the power of the perfection of wisdom, there is the attainment of full enlightenment,

analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba 'di gang zhe na /

analyzed: lta bar son pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa drug cu rtsa gnyis so //

analyzed: de rnams kyang gang yin zhe na //

analyzed: 'dir dge sbyong dang bram ze rtag par smra ba rnams kha cig bdag dang 'jig rten rtag par rab tu shes par byed pa min te de rnams kyang dngos po rnam pa bzhi po de la re zhig kha cig ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi ting nge 'dzin

analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yang dag par rgyu zhing 'khor bar 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar gyur pa rjes su dran par byed do ;

analyzed: pa dang skye ba dag rjes su dran zhing der yang 'di ltar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: med pa la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa dang yod pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin no //

original: de ni 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad smra ste /

analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa ste zhes bya ba'i rtag par smra ba rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi'o //

original: slar po ti 'ga' zhig la dus gsum bstan pas kyang so sor zad pa'am ma zad par 'gyur ba'am zad bzhin pa zhes bya ba dus gsum la yang zad pa med pa 'don pa yin no //

analyzed: nam mkha' mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du mi zad pa'i phyir ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa ste /

analyzed: de bas na de rnams kyi mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang nam mkha' bzhin du mi zad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom, which has the characteristic of non-apprehension of those, is also inexhaustible like space.

analyzed: mngon par bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni 'phel bar bya ba'o // gzugs zad pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To accomplish means to increase.üîΩ By the exhaustion of form, etc., means

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ni 'dir gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: the suchness of form, etc. is form, etc. here.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs nas de rnams la mi zad pa nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @274a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs nas de rnams la mi zad pa nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @274a * //
translated: Having observed the reality of form, etc., one should increase the perfection of wisdom by means of their inexhaustibility.

original: pa 'phel bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa 'phel bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: The same is true of ignorance, etc.

original: de la ma rig pa ni bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las kyi 'bras bu rnams ma rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las kyi 'bras bu rnams ma rtogs pa ste /
translated: Therein, ignorance is the non-understanding of the truths, the jewels, and the results of action.

original: ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang the tshom za ba'i phyir dang skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang the tshom za ba'i phyir dang skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro /
