original: bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa rnams la bdag nye bar dmigs pa dang 'dod chags las sogs pa dang de'i rab tu dbye ba'i 'du byed rnams ni lus la sogs pa'i las rnams kyis bsdus pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa rnams la bdag nye bar dmigs pa dang 'dod chags las sogs pa dang de'i rab tu dbye ba'i 'du byed rnams ni lus la sogs pa'i las rnams kyis bsdus pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The formations that are not the self but are perceived as the self, such as the attachment, etc., and their differentiation, are included in the three kinds of actions, i.e., bodily, etc.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: They have the nature of being virtuous, unvirtuous, and undefined.

original: 'di rnams las ma'i lto bar rnam par shes pa yang dag par zhugs pa khrag dang khu ba lhan cig tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bde ba dang sbyar ba'i ngo bo gcig pa nyid kyis skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams las ma'i lto bar rnam par shes pa yang dag par zhugs pa khrag dang khu ba lhan cig tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bde ba dang sbyar ba'i ngo bo gcig pa nyid kyis skyes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness enters the womb of the mother and father, and is born from the union of blood and semen with the happiness of the foundation consciousness.

original: zin pa'i phung po rnam par shes zhes bya ba byed brag tu smra ba'i 'don pas so //
analyzed: zin pa'i phung po rnam par shes zhes bya ba byed brag tu smra ba'i 'don pas so //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika s≈´tra says, ‚ÄúThe consciousness that appropriates the aggregates.‚Äù

original: ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gzhan dang dmigs pa gzhan rnams la ming du bya bas na ming ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gzhan dang dmigs pa gzhan rnams la ming du bya bas na ming ste /
translated: Name and form: Name is that which is named in other migrations and other objects.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa de'i tshe gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa de'i tshe gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: When it is included in the consciousnesses of engagement, it is the four kinds of formless aggregates.

original: gzugs ni nur nur po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni nur nur po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Form is the embryo and so on.

original: de dag la rnam par shes pa las 'phel bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de dag la rnam par shes pa las 'phel bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Consciousness increases in those.

original: ; ci ltar gsungs pa kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i lto ba la zhugs pa med na der yang ming dang gzugs de 'phel ba dang rgya che ba nyid du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ; ci ltar gsungs pa kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i lto ba la zhugs pa med na der yang ming dang gzugs de 'phel ba dang rgya che ba nyid du 'gyur ram /
translated: Ananda, if consciousness does not enter the mother's womb, would name-and-form develop and grow there?

original: de ni ma lags zhes skye ba dang ming dang gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags zhes skye ba dang ming dang gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa nyid las so //
translated: No, Blessed One, he replied. From consciousness.

original: 'phel ba ni legs par mtshon pa nyid kyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phel ba ni legs par mtshon pa nyid kyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One said, Ananda, it is well illustrated that growth is from consciousness.

original: skye mched drug ni ming dang gzugs de nyid la skye mched drug gi ngo bor yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni ming dang gzugs de nyid la skye mched drug gi ngo bor yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The six sense bases are the transformation of that name-and-form into the nature of the six sense bases.

original: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Contact is the convergence of the three: object, faculty, and consciousness.

original: de'i dbang gis yul rnams la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis yul rnams la 'jug pa'o //
translated: By its power, one engages with objects.

original: 'jug pa la tshor ba rnam pa gsum bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa la tshor ba rnam pa gsum bskyed pa'o //
translated: Engaging, one generates the three types of feelings.

original: de yod pa la bde ba la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba la sred pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod pa la bde ba la sogs pa'i nyams su myong ba la sred pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When that exists, craving for the experience of pleasure, etc. arises.

original: len pa ni srid pa gzhan du 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams la sems kyi rgyun 'dzin pas na len pa ste /
analyzed: len pa ni srid pa gzhan du 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams la sems kyi rgyun 'dzin pas na len pa ste /
translated: Grasping is the continuity of mind that holds on to the desire for another existence and so on.

original: srid pa gzhan gyis mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir las kyi bag chags nyid do //
analyzed: srid pa gzhan gyis mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir las kyi bag chags nyid do //
translated: It is the latent tendencies of karma because it connects with another existence.

original: 'byung @274b bar 'gyur ba'i khams gsum gyi srid pa'i 'bras bu can gyi las ni srid pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'byung @274b bar 'gyur ba'i khams gsum gyi srid pa'i 'bras bu can gyi las ni srid pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Karma that has the result of existence in the three realms is called existence.

original: 'dis de bar ma chad pas srid pa gzhan 'byung bas na shes pas so //
analyzed: 'dis de bar ma chad pas srid pa gzhan 'byung bas na shes pas so //
translated: It is existence because it arises as another existence without interruption.

original: skye ba ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi go rims kyis sems can rnams skyed par byed de gong nas gong du gnas skabs gzhan thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi go rims kyis sems can rnams skyed par byed de gong nas gong du gnas skabs gzhan thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Birth is the production of sentient beings through the sequence of stages of name and form and so on, because they attain other stages in a higher realm.

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad nyid ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad nyid ni skye ba'o //
translated: All the stages of name and form and so on are birth.

original: skye ba yod pa la lang tsho 'jig pa ni rgas pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba yod pa la lang tsho 'jig pa ni rgas pa'o //
translated: The destruction of youth when birth exists is aging.

original: srog 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: srog 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: The destruction of life is death.

original: gcig khas len pa med par yang rgas pas shi ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig khas len pa med par yang rgas pas shi ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and death occurs even without the acceptance of a single one.

original: mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas la ming dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams med pas skye mched drug la sogs pa yang dag par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas la ming dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams med pas skye mched drug la sogs pa yang dag par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: In the case of birth from the womb, the six sense spheres do not arise correctly because of the absence of name/form, etc.

original: srid pa dang bcas pa la dga' ba dang bde ba'i ngo bos bral bar gyur pa'i nang du gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: srid pa dang bcas pa la dga' ba dang bde ba'i ngo bos bral bar gyur pa'i nang du gdung ba ni mya ngan no //
translated: Sorrow is the internal burning of one who is attached to existence, due to the nature of separation from pleasure.

original: mya ngan gyis gdungs pa'i bla ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan gyis gdungs pa'i bla ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: Lamentation is the expression of sorrow.

original: dbang po lnga la mi bde ba ma lus par 'bab pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: dbang po lnga la mi bde ba ma lus par 'bab pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Suffering is the total influx of all that is unpleasant to the five sense faculties.

original: yid la mi 'dod pa 'bab pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid la mi 'dod pa 'bab pa ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is the influx of what is undesirable to the mind.

original: de'i sngon du 'gro ba can lus dang sems kyi ngal ba ni 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sngon du 'gro ba can lus dang sems kyi ngal ba ni 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Agitation is the fatigue of body and mind that precedes these.

original: 'di thams cad ni skye ba nyid las yang dag par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni skye ba nyid las yang dag par 'byung ngo //
translated: All of this arises from birth itself.

original: yid 'byung ba bskyed pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba bskyed pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught in order to generate disgust.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This, Subhuti, is the perfection of wisdom of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: gang zhig phung po la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid rnams la mi zad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang zhig phung po la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid rnams la mi zad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is the imperishability of the Suchness of the skandhas, etc.

original: mtha' gnyis ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dag go //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dag go //
translated: The two extremes are origination and cessation.

original: dbus ni skyes nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dbus ni skyes nas gnas pa'o //
translated: The middle is the persistence of what has originated.

original: ma 'dres pa ni gzhan rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni gzhan rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: Unmixed means not shared with others.

original: de ltar lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi zad pa bsgoms pa'i phan yon rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi zad pa bsgoms pa'i phan yon rnams so //
translated: The advantages of the meditation on the imperishable are stated beginning with ‚ÄúHe who thus looks upon the skandhas.

original: chos gang yang rgyu med par zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gang yang rgyu med par zhes bya ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNo dharma whatsoever‚Äù means because of the vision of dependent origination.

original: rtag pa'am zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //üîΩbrtan pa zhes bya ba ni skyes pa la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rtag pa'am zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o // brtan pa zhes bya ba ni skyes pa la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: ‚ÄúEternal‚Äù means without beginning or end.üîΩ‚ÄúStable‚Äù means because there is no destruction of what has originated.

original: ; ther zug ces bya ba ni 'ong ba dang nub pa'i ngo bos mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ; ther zug ces bya ba ni 'ong ba dang nub pa'i ngo bos mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPerduring‚Äù means because it does not persist by way of the nature of coming and going.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase it has the nature of not changing into something else means that it does not have a different state.

original: byed pa po'am tshor ba po zhes bya ba ni spong ba po dang 'dzin pa po med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrab 'byor 'di @275a * //
analyzed: byed pa po'am tshor ba po zhes bya ba ni spong ba po dang 'dzin pa po med pa'i phyir ro // rab 'byor 'di @275a * //
translated: The phrase it is not a doer or an experiencer means that it is not an agent or a knower.

original: ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzhung gi tshogs ni ci srid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ni go sla ba nyid do //üîΩrab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba ste gang gi phyir 'di chos thams cad kyi mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can yon tan 'di lta bu dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyu de las so //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzhung gi tshogs ni ci srid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar ni go sla ba nyid do // rab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba ste gang gi phyir 'di chos thams cad kyi mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can yon tan 'di lta bu dang ldan pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyu de las so //
translated: Subhuti, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas, the great beings, is the best, the highest, the most excellent, the most sublime, the unequalled, the foremost, the choicest, the most perfect of all the perfections.üîΩThe phrase Subhuti, therefore means that because this perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of the non-apprehension of all dharmas and possesses such qualities, it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: bas pa ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i dus la'o //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsgrub par bya ba byang chub ste /
analyzed: bas pa ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i dus la'o //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsgrub par bya ba byang chub ste /
translated: The phrase it is the best, the highest, the most excellent, the most sublime means that it is the best of all perfections.üîΩThe phrase it is the unequalled, the foremost, the choicest, the most perfect means that it is the foremost of all perfections.

original: de bas na ci ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya zhes de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na ci ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya zhes de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, one who practices the perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa med pas sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa med pas sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the three spheres are not completely pure, the perfections such as giving do not exist as the cause of perfect enlightenment.

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rag las pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rag las pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The complete purity of the three spheres depends on the perfection of wisdom.

original: thabs la mkhas pa la brtan par byed pa'i phyir thabs gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa la brtan par byed pa'i phyir thabs gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
translated: In order to stabilize skill in means, the means is taught: Subhuti, when, etc.üîΩWhy should one practice?

original: ci'i phyir bas ma par bya zhes bya ba'i dogs pa la gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bas ma par bya zhes bya ba'i dogs pa la gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: de dag gi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: because of their, etc.

original: bsam par bya ba'i 'bras bu gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bsam par bya ba'i 'bras bu gsungs pa ni /
translated: The result of reflection is stated:

original: de ltar bsams nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsams nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having reflected in that way, etc.

original: bdag gis kyang chos de dag ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bdag gis kyang chos de dag ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Those dharmas means the practices of the perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: sems bskyed pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni chos de dag rjes su thob par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni chos de dag rjes su thob par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: These arousings of mind means I will attain those dharmas and so on.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par brjod pa'o //
translated: Beginning with Subhuti, it is thus, for example, etc., the special qualities of the Bodhisattva are stated.

original: don 'di la srid pa nyid kyis gdul bya rnams kyi sbyor ba la chad du bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: don 'di la srid pa nyid kyis gdul bya rnams kyi sbyor ba la chad du bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: In this meaning, existence is for the sake of the practice of the disciples.

original: me tog bkram pa zhes bya ba'am de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su le'u 'di la lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: me tog bkram pa zhes bya ba'am de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su le'u 'di la lung bstan pa ste /
translated: The chapter is called The Display of Flowers or The Tathagatas' Prediction to the Bodhisattvas.

original: de bas na de rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni de'i le'u ste le'u nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o /üîΩ// / bsdus pa dang bar @275b ma dang rgyas pa la 'jug pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam shes pa nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bas na de rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i le'u ni de'i le'u ste le'u nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o / // / bsdus pa dang bar @275b ma dang rgyas pa la 'jug pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang lam shes pa nyid las brtsams te /
translated: Therefore, the chapter that illustrates those is called ‚ÄúThe Chapter on the Twenty-Eight.‚ÄùüîΩThose who engage in the concise, medium, and extensive [presentations] have completed the teachings on the perfection of wisdom that begin with the knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of the path.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstan pa la yongs su rdzogs par byas nas slar bde blag tu gzung ba'i don du thams cad du bsdus nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bstan pa la yongs su rdzogs par byas nas slar bde blag tu gzung ba'i don du thams cad du bsdus nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par mdzad pa ni /
translated: In order to easily grasp them all, the BhagavƒÅn has taught by condensing them all into one.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ga sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ga sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, moreover‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rims pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rims pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means in the order that will be explained.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsdus pa dang lam shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa dang rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsdus pa dang lam shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa dang rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom‚Äù is included in the knowledge of all aspects, included in the knowledge of the path, and has conceptual and non-conceptual [aspects].

original: chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis chag par mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis chag par mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are unattached, means because they are not suitable to be attached to due to being essenceless.

original: 'o na chung zad yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na chung zad yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: But if they do not exist in the least, then what is the point of teaching the Dharma?

original: chos thams cad dper mi phye pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dper mi phye pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are not differentiated, means

original: dbyer mi phyed pa ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pa ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: because they are not differentiated in terms of emptiness.

original: gang gis don dag par chos thams cad gcig pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gang gis don dag par chos thams cad gcig pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: By what means are all phenomena of the same nature?

original: 'o na de ltar yin na de'i ngo bos dngos po nyid du thal ba zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar yin na de'i ngo bos dngos po nyid du thal ba zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: But if that is so, then it follows that they are entities.

original: chos thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are unarisen, means

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba brjod pa'i don du dngos po dang dngos po med pa las grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba brjod pa'i don du dngos po dang dngos po med pa las grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: that the general characteristic of all phenomena is not existent by the nature of entities. The meaning of this statement is that the intention is to be free from entity and nonentity.

original: gal te de ltar gcig pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad yin na 'o na 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di ni rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba ci ltar yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gcig pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad yin na 'o na 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di ni rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba ci ltar yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: If all phenomena are of the same nature in that way, then how can there be a division into such things as this is afflicted and this is pure?

original: chos thams cad 'gyur pa med par mnyam pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gyur pa med par mnyam pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that it is because all phenomena are the same in being unchanging.

original: gang zhig chos rnams kyi 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin 'di ni de dang mnyam pa ste kun rdzob pa'i spros pa'i ngo bos kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig chos rnams kyi 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin 'di ni de dang mnyam pa ste kun rdzob pa'i spros pa'i ngo bos kyang ma yin no //
translated: This nature of phenomena, which is their unchanging emptiness, is the same as that, not even in terms of the nature of conventional elaborations.

original: 'on te gang gis 'di chos rnams kyi gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid des kyang 'di rnams mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te gang gis 'di chos rnams kyi gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid des kyang 'di rnams mnyam pa ste /
translated: Or, it is because this is the same as that dependent nature of phenomena, the nature of consciousness.

original: de bas na mi 'gyur ba dang mnyam pa ci'i phyir brjod ces gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na mi 'gyur ba dang mnyam pa ci'i phyir brjod ces gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, why is it said to be unchanging and the same?

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa dang rnam par rig pa med par shes rab kyis rjes su rtogs pas zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan dbang @276a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa dang rnam par rig pa med par shes rab kyis rjes su rtogs pas zhes bya ba ste / 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan dbang @276a * //
translated: By the wisdom that knows all phenomena to be selfless and without cognitive representations.

original: ni brdzun pa'i snang ba'i ngo bo 'khrul pa tsam nyid de /
analyzed: ni brdzun pa'i snang ba'i ngo bo 'khrul pa tsam nyid de /
translated: The dependent nature, which is the essence of these, is the mere error that is the essence of false appearances.

original: de bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis ci lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa'i phyir des kyang ci'i phyir na mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis ci lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa'i phyir des kyang ci'i phyir na mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since it is not realized as it is by the wisdom that transcends the world, why would it be the same?

original: 'on te dngos po rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid rtogs nas de bzhin gshegs pas gang la yang bstan pa des de las shes nas mngon sum du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te dngos po rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid rtogs nas de bzhin gshegs pas gang la yang bstan pa des de las shes nas mngon sum du bya ba'o //
translated: But if the nature of the reality of things is realized, then the TathƒÅgata teaches it to someone, and they understand it and actualize it.

original: gal te gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang med na ci zhig gang gis gang la bstan par bya ba zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang med na ci zhig gang gis gang la bstan par bya ba zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: But if the dependent nature does not exist, what is taught by whom to whom?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ming tsam dang tha snyad tsam gyis brjod pa 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan dbang yang sgra'i yul gyi ngo bo nyams su myong ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩtha snyad kyi de kho na nyid la 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ming tsam dang tha snyad tsam gyis brjod pa 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan dbang yang sgra'i yul gyi ngo bo nyams su myong ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to // tha snyad kyi de kho na nyid la 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúAll phenomena are merely names, merely labels‚Äù is that the dependent nature, which is the basis of the ascription of those names and labels, is not the object of words.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúIt is the source of conventional usage‚Äù means

original: tha snyad gdags pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha snyad gdags pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: that it is the basis of the designation of conventional expressions.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is not‚Äù means that if a word expresses a thing, then it would be the nature of that thing.

original: gang la yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te sgra gang gis dngos po gang zhig brjod par gyur na de'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe gzung ba las snga rol du yang brda la mi mkhas pa rnams kyang dngos po de ming des gzungüîΩbar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te sgra gang gis dngos po gang zhig brjod par gyur na de'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba de'i tshe gzung ba las snga rol du yang brda la mi mkhas pa rnams kyang dngos po de ming des gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, even before the apprehension of the object, those who are not familiar with the convention would apprehend that thing by that name.

original: de bas na ming de gang gis gang du tha snyad gdags par bya /
analyzed: de bas na ming de gang gis gang du tha snyad gdags par bya /
translated: Therefore, by what name is it designated?

original: gang gis kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te brda la tha snyad de mngon par gsal ba tsam du thob par 'gyur na mar me las bum pa bzhin du sngar yang dngos po de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te brda la tha snyad de mngon par gsal ba tsam du thob par 'gyur na mar me las bum pa bzhin du sngar yang dngos po de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúBy no one at all‚Äù means that if the convention were to be obtained by the mere manifestation of the convention in the sign, then, like a pot from a lamp, the nature of that thing would be prior.

original: gal te de ltar yin na shing gi sgras brda'i stobs kyis dus nam du yang bum pa brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na shing gi sgras brda'i stobs kyis dus nam du yang bum pa brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the word ‚Äútree‚Äù would never express a pot by the power of the sign.

original: don thams cad sgra thams cad kyis brda'i dbang gis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don thams cad sgra thams cad kyis brda'i dbang gis brjod pa yin no //
translated: All things are expressed by all words by the power of the sign.

original: sgra rnams ni 'ga' zhig tu yan lag bkug par byed cing mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnams ni 'ga' zhig tu yan lag bkug par byed cing mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Words are not seen to be bent in some places.

original: de bas na brda las tha snyad ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na brda las tha snyad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no convention from the sign.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po gcig nyid la ming sna tshogs pa mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po gcig nyid la ming sna tshogs pa mthong ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever‚Äù and so on means that a single thing is seen to have various names.

original: sa dang sa gzhi dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sa dang sa gzhi dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Earth, ground, and so on.

original: dngos po gcig nyid la sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig nyid la sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical for a single thing to have a variety of natures.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus nas ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus nas ston par byed pa ste /
translated: The statement all phenomena and so on is a summary indication.

original: brjod du med pa ni brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi ngo bos tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi ngo bos tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The inexpressible is not conventionally expressed by the nature of the expressed and the expresser.

original: 'o na ci ltar de nyid du yod pa @276b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar de nyid du yod pa @276b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: If one asks, How is the perfection of wisdom, which exists in reality, to be taught?

original: chos thams cad la tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said, because all phenomena are without valid cognition.

original: gang zhig chos rnams thams cad kyi don dam pa thams cad du 'gro ba nyid kyis tshad ma dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de nyid kyis kun rdzob tu bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ngo bo nyid ces gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhig chos rnams thams cad kyi don dam pa thams cad du 'gro ba nyid kyis tshad ma dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de nyid kyis kun rdzob tu bstan par bya zhes bya ba'i don to // de nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi yang ngo bo nyid ces gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning is that by that very emptiness which is the ultimate of all phenomena, which is free from valid cognition because it is the universal of all, one should teach conventionally.

original: gzugs tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs tshad ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: That very nature of form and so on is stated in because form is without valid cognition and so on.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa de dang de phan tshun du mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bo las gzhan tshad ma zhes bya ba dngos po cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa de dang de phan tshun du mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bo las gzhan tshad ma zhes bya ba dngos po cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But there is no entity whatsoever called a valid cognition that is different from the nature of those things, such as blue, which are devoid of those characteristics.

original: de'i phyir ci ltar des rjes su 'gro ba zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar des rjes su 'gro ba zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, how is it that it is said to be ‚Äúconcordant‚Äù?

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúall phenomena are without characteristics.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad la mtshan ma med pa ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo'i spros pa thams cad med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mtshan ma med pa ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo'i spros pa thams cad med pa'o //
translated: The absence of characteristics of all phenomena is the absence of all conceptual elaborations of the nature of the imagined and the dependent.

original: de las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: From that, the perfection of wisdom should be understood.

original: 'o na de ltar dngos po med pa ni ci zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar dngos po med pa ni ci zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: But if that is so, then what is that non-entity called the perfection of wisdom?

original: chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúall phenomena are definitely discerned.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bos 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bos 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: The ascertainment of all phenomena is the realization by supramundane wisdom of the perfected nature.

original: de las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom is that.

original: 'on te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: But what is the meaning of the perfection of wisdom?

original: gal te rnam par dag pa zhes zer na gang gis rnam par dag pa yin /
analyzed: gal te rnam par dag pa zhes zer na gang gis rnam par dag pa yin /
translated: If you say it is purity, by what is it purified?

original: bdag la ni ma yin te de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la ni ma yin te de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not by itself, because it does not exist.

original: phung po lnga rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: Nor by the five aggregates,üîΩbecause they do not exist in reality.

original: de rnams kyang de kho na nyid du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /üîΩchos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang de kho na nyid du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni / chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said:üîΩBecause all phenomena are pure by nature.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid de de dag pas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid de de dag pas so //
translated: The nature of all phenomena is emptiness, because they are pure of that.

original: gal te yang stong pa nyid kyang rang bzhin nyid kyis dag pa de lta na yang glo bur ba'i sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams kyis dri ma can du byed do //
analyzed: gal te yang stong pa nyid kyang rang bzhin nyid kyis dag pa de lta na yang glo bur ba'i sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams kyis dri ma can du byed do //
translated: Even if emptiness itself is pure by nature, adventitious stains of obscuration make it stained.

original: dper na nam mkha' sprin dang / mun pa dang ba mo la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' sprin dang / mun pa dang ba mo la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: For example, space is by clouds, darkness, fog, and so on.

original: @277a * // phyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid de rnams bsal bas rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @277a * // phyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid de rnams bsal bas rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Later, by the perfection of wisdom itself removing those, it becomes pure.

original: dper na nam mkha' rlung la sogs pa rnams kyis sprin la sogs pa bsal bas so //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' rlung la sogs pa rnams kyis sprin la sogs pa bsal bas so //
translated: For example, space is by wind, etc. removing clouds, etc.

original: 'on te glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams spong ba med pas gnyen po mi srid pas te /
analyzed: 'on te glo bur ba'i dri ma rnams spong ba med pas gnyen po mi srid pas te /
translated: But if the removal of adventitious stains is impossible, the antidote is impossible,

original: de bas na thams cad grol bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad grol bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and therefore it follows that all are liberated.

original: gnyen po yongs su shes pa ni bstan pa med pas de bstan pa yang kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yul lo //
analyzed: gnyen po yongs su shes pa ni bstan pa med pas de bstan pa yang kun brtags kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yul lo //
translated: The complete knowledge of the antidote is not taught, and so its teaching is the domain of the imagined reality.

original: kun brtags kyi ngo bo yang cung zad byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi ngo bo yang cung zad byed pa ma yin te /
translated: And the imagined reality does not do anything at all.

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Because it does not exist like the horn of a rabbit.

original: chos thams cad tshig med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad tshig med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is because all things are inexpressible.

original: 'di nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo'i dmigs pa can gyi sgom pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo'i dmigs pa can gyi sgom pa ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This itself is the meditation that has the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, which is not expressible, in order to manifest the ultimate nature.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nges pa'i phyir sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nges pa'i phyir sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is the practice because of the certainty of the nature of cause and effect. This is the intended meaning.

original: 'o na kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi stong pa nyid ni gnyen po skyes pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi stong pa nyid ni gnyen po skyes pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, if afflicted emptiness is purified by the arising of the antidote,

original: de bas na de'i 'dus byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'dus byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: then it follows that it is conditioned.

original: 'gog pa med pas zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir dri ma yod pa rnams nyid la spang ba med ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa med pas zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir dri ma yod pa rnams nyid la spang ba med ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because there is no cessation, it is said that all phenomena are naturally pure, so there is no abandonment of those that have stains. This is the intended meaning.

original: spong ba dang mnyam pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyon dang bral ba nyid kyis sngar yang spong ba dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong ba dang mnyam pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyon dang bral ba nyid kyis sngar yang spong ba dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being the same as the abandonment means that it is the same as the abandonment because of being free from faults.

original: 'on te de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yod mod /
analyzed: 'on te de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yod mod /
translated: But if suchness exists as pure by nature,

original: chos thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas dri ma can du mthong ste ;
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas dri ma can du mthong ste ;
translated: then all phenomena are seen as defiled by the stains of attachment and so on.

original: de bas na dus thams cad du rnam par ma dag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na dus thams cad du rnam par ma dag par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they would be impure at all times:üîΩAll phenomena attain nirvana.

original: chos thams cad ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob cing zhes bya ba ste ci ltar de bzhin nyid de ltar chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob cing zhes bya ba ste ci ltar de bzhin nyid de ltar chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Just as suchness is, so too all phenomena are pure by nature.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By means of the sameness of suchness.

original: ci ltar de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa de ltar de rnams yang ngo //
analyzed: ci ltar de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa de ltar de rnams yang ngo //
translated: Just as suchness is naturally pure, so too are they.

original: de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid ci ltar zhes gsungs pa ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩmi 'ong zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus las so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid ci ltar zhes gsungs pa ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste / mi 'ong zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus las so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena are undifferentiated,üîΩnot coming, not going, not unborn, not arisen, not non-arisen, not ceased,

original: @277b mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus la'o //
analyzed: @277b mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus la'o //
translated: not annihilated, not permanent, not single, not manifold, not coming, not leaving,üîΩnot diminished, not increased, not manifest, not unmanifest, not decreased, not increased, not defiled, not purified, not grasped, not ungrasped, not bound, not liberated.‚Äù

original: de ltar na dus mi shes pa'i phyir chos thams cad mi shes mi skye shin tu mi skye zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dus mi shes pa'i phyir chos thams cad mi shes mi skye shin tu mi skye zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, because of not knowing the three times, one does not know all phenomena, one does not generate, one does not fully generate.

original: 'di tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub bo //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa sgrub bo //
translated: With just this much, the bodhisattvas accomplish the perfection of their own aim.

original: 'di rnams kyi rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba yod mod /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba yod mod /
translated: This is called the perfection of their own aim.

original: de'i don du dka' ba nyid kyis shin tu dka' ba yang nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don du dka' ba nyid kyis shin tu dka' ba yang nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, it is also very difficult, since it is difficult to attain.

original: gzhan don ni dka' ba ste sems can rnams mtha' yas pa'i phyir dang nyon mongs pa'i zhags pa rnams kyis shin tu bcings pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan don ni dka' ba ste sems can rnams mtha' yas pa'i phyir dang nyon mongs pa'i zhags pa rnams kyis shin tu bcings pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The aim of others is difficult, since sentient beings are infinite and are very much bound by the snares of the afflictions.

original: bdag dang gzhan du mi lta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mi lta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because he does not see self and other.

original: bdag dang gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa gang yin pa de mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa gang yin pa de mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not see the difference called self and other.

original: sems can thams cad la bdag nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bdag nyid dang mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he sees all sentient beings as the same as himself.

original: 'di'i 'og tu dka' ba'i 'du shes kyi gnyen por ci lta ba so sor rtogs par bya ba de ltar gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i 'og tu dka' ba'i 'du shes kyi gnyen por ci lta ba so sor rtogs par bya ba de ltar gsungs pa ni /
translated: After that, the remedy for the idea of difficulty is taught as the discernment of reality.

original: de la dang po sems can rnams la dgra bcom pa nyid la sogs pa'i dka' ba'i 'du shes gsal ba'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la dang po sems can rnams la dgra bcom pa nyid la sogs pa'i dka' ba'i 'du shes gsal ba'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: In that regard, in order to clarify the idea of difficulty with regard to sentient beings, such as the state of an arhat, it is said:

original: chos thams cad 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: All phenomena are the state of an arhat.

original: chos thams cad ni sems can gyi tha snyad kyi yul rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sems can gyi tha snyad kyi yul rnams so //
translated: All phenomena are the objects of the conventions of sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa ni gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa ni gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The state of an arhat is pure by nature.

original: chos nyid tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is merely the reality.

original: khur mi khyer ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khur la rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khur mi khyer ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khur la rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not carry a burden means that a burden has no intrinsic reality.

original: sems can gdul ba'i don du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bas dka' ba'i 'du shes bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sems can gdul ba'i don du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bas dka' ba'i 'du shes bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to eliminate the notion of difficulty with regard to going to the buddha-fields in the ten directions for the sake of taming sentient beings, it is said:

original: chos thams cad yul med cing phyogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad yul med cing phyogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are non-objective and non-directional.

original: yul med pa'i phyir dang phyogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir dang phyogs med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because they are non-objective and non-directional.

original: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid de de'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid de de'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: By the intrinsic essence means that the intrinsic nature of form and so forth is thusness, by its very essence.

original: de'i yul ni yod pa ma yin te mi ltung ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni yod pa ma yin te mi ltung ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its object does not exist, because it is a non-falling phenomenon.

original: phyogs kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Its direction also does not exist,

original: nam mkha' bzhin du cha dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'khor ba'i bde ba la dor ba'i 'du @278a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du cha dang bral ba'i phyir ro // 'khor ba'i bde ba la dor ba'i 'du @278a * //
translated: because it is partless like space.

original: shes dka' ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: shes dka' ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to eliminate the notion of difficulty with regard to giving up the pleasures of cyclic existence, it is said:

original: chos thams cad 'khor ba pa rnams kyi 'gog pa la rab tu sim pa nyid ni bde ba'i 'du shes skyed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'khor ba pa rnams kyi 'gog pa la rab tu sim pa nyid ni bde ba'i 'du shes skyed pa'o //
translated: The satisfaction of all dharmas in the cessation of those in cyclic existence is the generation of the notion of happiness.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom should be understood.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag //üîΩskye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can te //
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag // skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can te //
translated: Alas! Conditioned things are impermanent.üîΩThey have the nature of arising and passing away.

original: skyes nas 'jig par 'gyur ba bas //üîΩde bas myur du zhi na bde //
analyzed: skyes nas 'jig par 'gyur ba bas // de bas myur du zhi na bde //
translated: Having arisen, they cease.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, their pacification is bliss.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni nyin thos kyi 'dul bar byed pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni nyin thos kyi 'dul bar byed pa gsungs so //
translated: This much is said to be the Vinaya of the Hearers.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul bar byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul bar byed pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: With reference to the Vinaya of the Bodhisattvas, it is said:

original: dga' pa med cing dga' ba dang bral ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dga' pa med cing dga' ba dang bral ba med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Without joy, without separation from joy.

original: dka' ba ni mngon par dga' ba la 'di'i dga' ba ni 'khor ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dka' ba ni mngon par dga' ba la 'di'i dga' ba ni 'khor ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, joy is not in the face of difficulty, but in cyclic existence or nirvana.

original: de bzhin du 'di'i dga' ba dang bral ba yang 'khor ba las ma yin mya ngan las 'das pa las kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di'i dga' ba dang bral ba yang 'khor ba las ma yin mya ngan las 'das pa las kyang ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the separation of this one is not from samsara, nor is it from nirvana.

original: gal te 'khor ba la mngon par dga' bar gyur na de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa can 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba la mngon par dga' bar gyur na de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa can 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he were to delight in samsara, then he would be defiled and would remain in samsara.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang 'khor zhing bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang 'khor zhing bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And being defiled, he would not bring to maturity his own qualities of a Buddha, while remaining in samsara.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du nus par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du nus par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he would not be able to perfect the transcendences such as generosity.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he would not bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur na myur ba myur ba nyid du sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur na myur ba myur ba nyid du sems can gyi khams la ltos pa med pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he were to delight in nirvana, then he would quickly enter into complete nirvana, without regard for the realm of sentient beings, and would not bring the qualities of a Buddha to completion.

original: de bzhin du gal te 'di 'khor ba las dga' ba dang bral bar yang 'gyur na nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa nyid la ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te 'di 'khor ba las dga' ba dang bral bar yang 'gyur na nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa nyid la ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if it were to be separated from delight in cyclic existence, it would fall into the nirvana of the Sravakas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las kyang dga' ba dang bral na byang chub kyi sems kyang nye bar 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las kyang dga' ba dang bral na byang chub kyi sems kyang nye bar 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it were to be separated from delight in nirvana, the Thought of Enlightenment would not grow.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang 'khor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang 'khor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And if it were to be defiled, it would fall into cyclic existence.

original: ci ltar yang 'di dga' ba dang bral ba dag la yang dag par 'byung ba ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ci ltar yang 'di dga' ba dang bral ba dag la yang dag par 'byung ba ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: How is it that it does not arise in those who are separated from delight?

original: 'dod chags med cing @278b 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags med cing @278b 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said: because there is no attachment and no separation from attachment, etc.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang dngos por 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang dngos por 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags med pa'o //
translated: There is no attachment because there is no grasping at self and no grasping at things.

original: yid 'byung ba'i rgyu rgas pa dang 'chi ba la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin med par rtogs par rtogs pas 'khor ba las shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'o //üîΩci ltar yang 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: yid 'byung ba'i rgyu rgas pa dang 'chi ba la sogs pa rnams la rang bzhin med par rtogs par rtogs pas 'khor ba las shin tu 'dod chags dang bral ba med pa'o // ci ltar yang 'di zhes bya /
translated: Since one realizes that the causes of disgust, such as old age and death, are devoid of intrinsic reality, one is not utterly detached from cyclic existence.üîΩHow is this so?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Fearing that one might think this, he says,

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, form is not one thing and illusion another,

original: gal te de ltar yin na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa la 'di mngon par chags par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa la 'di mngon par chags par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: If this is so, then one might think that one would become attached to liberation, which is characterized by non-abiding in cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: chos thams cad chags pa dang ma chags pa'i zhen pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad chags pa dang ma chags pa'i zhen pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He says that this is not so, because all phenomena are free from the attachment and non-attachment of conceptualization.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi dga' ba'i mtshan nyid can thar pa la de rnams chags pa thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi dga' ba'i mtshan nyid can thar pa la de rnams chags pa thob pa ma yin no //
translated: One does not become attached to liberation, which is characterized by non-attachment to cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na chags pa dang ma chags pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang du yang chags pa'am ma chags pa nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na chags pa dang ma chags pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang du yang chags pa'am ma chags pa nye bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Why? Because of the absence of attachment and nonattachment.

original: 'o na ngo bo gang gis de rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'am 'khor ba la mthong zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na ngo bo gang gis de rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'am 'khor ba la mthong zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, by what nature do they see nirvana or samsara?

original: byang chub bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He says:

original: byang chub ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: byang chub ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Enlightenment is the nature of the Dharma Body, which is emptiness.

original: chos thams cad ni longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: All dharmas are of the nature of the Enjoyment and Transformation Bodies.

original: gnyis po 'di dag la yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis gang zhig khong du chud par byed pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag la yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis gang zhig khong du chud par byed pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: And the nature of both of these is realized by supramundane gnosis.

original: de ltar 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid thar pa'i rang bzhin brjod nas rgyu gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid thar pa'i rang bzhin brjod nas rgyu gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having thus described the nature of liberation, which is the characteristic of not abiding in either cyclic existence or nirvana, the cause is stated:üîΩThe emptiness of all phenomena

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: is the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: gang gi phyir 'di chos rnams thams cad rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum nyid kyis sgom par byed pa de bas na 'khor bar ltung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di chos rnams thams cad rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum nyid kyis sgom par byed pa de bas na 'khor bar ltung ba ma yin no //
translated: Because of this, one meditates on all phenomena as the three gates of liberation, and therefore does not fall into cyclic existence.üîΩWhy does one not fall into nirvana?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la ci'i phyir mi ltung zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la ci'i phyir mi ltung zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is stated:

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs @279a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs @279a * //
translated: All phenomena are like medicine,
